BgJjXeOs4LRop30u9CSCeA.text: All these Poke places are becoming very ubiquitous...and that's fine by me! You can't go wrong with most of these places as it's very similar. Pick your carbs, pick your fish, pick your toppings...etc. Nothing we aren't already used to.  I've eaten here and its other locations on several occasions and never had a bad experience. I love the complimentary refreshments they have such as the barley, corn and jasmine(?) water. The service is always friendly and the girls working there are pretty cute (just saying :D).  Every location has a check-in deal via Facebook that saves you mula + a stamp card. You really get the bang for your buck. Dine in and you get free miso soup as well. They just love showering you with freebies and I'm not complaining man.  Lastly, the macaroon ice cream is my favorite. I've seen the same ice cream at several different restaurants and they seem to be slowly replacing mochi ice creams to be the next staple, cool treat. Love this place and the one on eastern/215, I'll be writing a separate review for that one as well.  Keep doing what you do PP, stay cool, don't change

dCgguQBSlzmhtaERrH6hSw.text: I really enjoy having this place next to my gym. Its always nice having a healthy food option close. The customer service is excellent and their food is very fresh. If you dine in you get a complimentary cup of miso and they also offer infused waters at no price. These little things show that they care about their customers and want them to have a good experience.

BUSPovs2MXD_gXtHYxzwIw.text: Poke bars are a dime a dozen these days, but some much better than others . Poke Poku calls themselves a Hawaiian style poke bar, but I am not sure what is "Hawaiian" about it. I  think they are about the same as other places, with the exception of some fried appetizers and desserts.  What I liked: - Complimentary teas available - Free Miso soup when you dine in - Free Wi-Fi - Fruit toppings like pineapple and mango - Lots of fun sauce combinations  - Friendly workers   What I didn't like  - Avocado is offered as a side, but it's more like guacamole. I dont care for guacamole in my poke bowl and I'd rather have fresh avocado. - The price is much more expensive than competitors. A large bowl, which is 4 scoops of protein, is $13.50.   -The miso soup, although free, was only filled up a quarter of the way full and was pretty tasteless.  All in all, if I want to spend $15 on lunch, I will probably go elsewhere.

RmoYsVUp4c7ev4UFc3Z1ww.text: I'm giving this place a 5 even though poke just isn't my thing. Everyone else (6 other people) loves their food the other day when we came in to grab food to go. I think I'm just not a fan of poke in general. I did like how you can completely customize your bowl and they have A LOT of options. The price is good too. I would come back here for sure if I ever needed poke for the family again.

Gmztr5PHzQmLwNsKzZYWNA.text: We went there this past Friday and I had the lunch combo two, which happened to be a salad.  I literally had the very nice associate pick and choose for me.  Great service and super good portions.  Get the stamp card and you'll notice a little gift.....a Bible scripture!   Not only do you get a great meal for a good price, but then you get a refreshing reminder to bring you through your day.  No doubt this place is five stars..

WEpZOz45tI_2SzAF4O5XHw.text: Hopefully owner pays attention to this review...  We came on Friday around 8:30pm. When ordering the girl informed us that they close at 9pm and asked if we're taking it to go to which I said no... we're dining in. While we were eating the food (which was OK but nothing special in a world of poke bowls) they started vigorously cleaning the store and putting the chairs up. Made us feel "very welcome"... like "can you hurry up and get out since we want to close now" welcome. By 8:52pm the sign was off and store was closed. In my opinion... if your hours are till 9pm - you serve till 9pm. Otherwise there is a whole bunch of other places to choose from where we are not rushed out of the door because staff looks like they are late for a Friday night party.

TB2-wZcVLXHVphlBUWQOVw.text: If you're looking for genuine Hawaiian style poke, this is the place to go. You can build your own bowl and get all your favorite stuff, and even get bomb ramen too. The atmosphere is local style and music is on point. if you're a local kid looking for a taste of home, highly recommended

S60M6DkUW73Oi3IHzloONQ.text: Not only do they have an amazing selection of toppings, seafood and sauces the staff is always extremely friendly and remember me every time I come in! Good food plus good customer service. I'm a loyal customer and will continue to be one! I haven't had one bowl that was the same because there so many options and they always recommend different combinations of sauces to mix it up!! If you aren't sure what to order then just ask the people at the counter what works well. This place is SUPER CLEAN! Definitely a huge selling point for me. We will be back without a doubt.

setKp09zIVRnF-sHhCNnDA.text: This place is not a run-of-the-mill poke place.  They put great care and attention into each ingredient.  The sashimi is fresh and melts in your mouth.  The seaweed salad is fresh and crunchy.  The tamago tastes sweet and moist, of highest quality.  There's many more toppings you will find only here like crunchy onion, tobiko, mango, pineapple, etc.  I have come twice already and plan to come back many more times.  This place is a little more expensive than the other poke places, but I'd rather save my money and eat once in a while at a place like this than eating at the other typical poke places.  Highly recommend if you're coming from out of town.  I was surprised to find this place in the middle of Spring Valley, such a random place to stumble over great poke!

_8EBWWjbdwRM41f638HkuA.text: Delicious, big bowls of sushi and a variety of flavorful toppings, including Kizami nori! Try their fresh assortment of drinks such as their complimentary burdock root iced tea. I can't wait until they start serving the Tornado Potato which is a tasty fried potato swirl that I've recently tried in Korea. :3

CRcaxm_bLuIaodexbfsuMA.text: I have been waiting to try this place out since hearing some good reviews from friends. Finally decided to go and saw that it was on Yelp Eat24 so I placed an online order for pick up. I ordered a Poke Burrito and a Poke Bowl. Went in a little early to see if it happened to be ready and was told they "forgot" the order. Waited some more and then was told they ran out of spicy tuna. Opted for the tuna and waited again and finally it was ready. Since it wasn't busy inside decided to dine in. Opened bowl and saw no sauce. Took first bite and tasted no sauce although they said it was on there. Waited again to get a side of sauce. After all that the bowl was very good. The burrito was too. Then I get to the mochi ice cream and it was hard as a rock and you could see the icicles on top. Asked if they could defrost it and they said they would. Then they come back to say all their mochi is like that and offered to give a macaron ice cream sandwich in place of the mochi. That was very nice of them. Despite the mishaps during my very first visit here, I will be coming back because the food was delicious and I hope to have a much better experience.

ypyxuCm6w7-wFQdnpk25-A.text: Love the food and have been back a few times.    My biggest complaint is the customer service.   The first employee to acknowledge we were there came and stood in front of us without greeting us in any way.  No "hi", no smile. Just stood there.  She seemed very put out to have to do her job.  The second employee working the line seemed annoyed when I wanted my sauce on the side.  No smile or politeness from any of the 3 workers.  The owner needs to watch this.  I don't care how good the food is somewhere, if the employees annoy me I won't go back.  Business lost for them.

yXdP3nZO6nXnT8INOhnb6Q.text: First time here - the BOGO happy hour from 2-5 brought me here. Buy one bowl/burrito whatever and get the second one free, for dine in only though which is fine. This place was very similar to many other poke places that are springing up in las vegas now. You have to pick your starter- white rice, brown, rice, salad, or mixed salad then you move on to your normal proteins and toppings. I was kind of sad they had run out of yellowtail already though (it was around 300?). They did just open so I think they are still trying to get everything right - I say this because they were really slow, but this is something I think they will get with time. The miso soup was a little salty. Oh! They have multiple desserts you can get like the potato twister! I wanted to try it but I had already gotten a medium size bowl with 3 proteins in it They have a multitude of sauces and one secret sauce that wasn't on the wall they provide called the GUCCI SAUCE. This shiz was good. I can't tell you what's in it because they would not tell me whatsoever..it's the secret sauce haha I also really liked the feel of this place - very Hawaii and made me feel really relaxed. One thing I distinctly remember is one of the waitresses/workers (?) walking around wiping tables with Christian Louboutin heels on LOL I give her props for working in this type of establishment with high heels lolol I will definitely be back to test this place out again.

PC4RMpPHh6-vX--20YqInw.text: It's been a while since I've been to a poke place, and I'm very glad I chose this one. gfKe6c9tEN7Hl7Um8yFZjA.text: I come here regularly since I've been trying to eat more fish. The ordering style is similar to chipotle's. You start at one end, and order step by step. Starting with either a salad or bowl option (with several sizing options). Next you choose your sides. They have many options to chose from; Spicy crab meat, regular crab meat, avocado, edamame, etc..Next up you get to pick your fish. They have so many fish options including yellowtail, ahi, and octopus. The fish is always fresh and plentiful. Then you chose your sauce, and toppings. There are free teas you can drink and the music they play is awesome.  Don't forget to use their punch card for frequent purchases.

ZazZOJLB2zltkskFZAcvSA.text: I have come here about 8 times now. Each time I order I tip. Today is where I draw the line with tipping. fafRBum8LKSlUSZ-Am9n5w.text: Its that haole poke. I get it people want to get on that trendy shit but dont say "hawaiian" style poke because not even close.

_0HSAIK0CQ8YmMh7WV4upg.text: My first time trying a sushi burrito and it was AMAZING. So good I went to another place that served a similar item and realized just how much better this place is! The guys working were really friendly and helpful to my family and myself since it was our first time and we were pretty clueless. The meal came with miso soup and they had multiple complimentary teas you could try. This might just be my new favorite place.

IH-Ai8mBUzqzJspV1hHh2g.text: This place is amazing (and this is coming from someone who has tried 80% of the poke places in Vegas). I'm not even finished eating my poke but I felt so compelled to rave about it because it is very worth the praise that other yelp reviews have given it. They have 3 sizes (small, medium, and large) and as I have mentioned in a previous Yelp review, usually poke places only have regular and large sizes. The amount of toppings that you can get for no additional charge is huge! Including 5 different colors of masago, a super duper delicious soft shell crab mix, full cloves of roasted garlic, bonito flakes, etc. I also love that they are really generous with their portions...you will definitely be full even with a small! Additionally, they have complimentary health teas on the side which go well with the poke!   Service is very friendly and helpful(they even gave me an extra topping choice for no reason), sauce choices are unique and delicious, and overall this place is just plain awesome. Do yourself a favor and stop by! I live quite far from here, but after trying this place, I will definitely be back because I think I found my new favorite poke restaurant!

xmjawv2O-DA7HhHlusL9Ww.text: My favorite poke place in Vegas. I'm hooked! Probably come here more than I should lol. Good quality fish. Great choice of sides. Other places will charge extra for masago or avocado but poke poke does not. Love the complimentary teas they provide as well.

ygx6q5w9HlUMKBiOHgCLcQ.text: Came here for the first time on the way home-ish after some appointments on the SW side. My friend had just came here earlier on the day and told our "group" (fb chat) about the lunch special. Sushi Burrito with miso soup (dine in only) for $5, their house-made teas (dine in only - varies per day), and 3 gyoza ($1.50 extra)  -----------------------  Their original menu is as follows  Step 0 - Poke Bowl/Poke Salad - Small $9.50 (2 scoops), Medium $11.50 (3 scoops), Large $13.50 (4 scoops). Hawaiian poke - 5 oz $8.00, 10 oz $14.00. Poke burrito - 1 scoop $7.50, 2 scoop $9.00.   Sides - Shrimp Shumai $5.00 (6 pieces), Gyoza $5.00 (6 pieces), Takoyaki $4.00 (6 pieces)  Step 1 - Base - White rice, brown rice, half and half, mixed salad  Step 2 - Sides (Choose 2 - Extra side +$1.50) - Seaweed salad, edamame, crab meat, spicy crab meat, avocado, fried shrimp tempura  Step 3 - Protein (Extra Protein +$1.75) - Tuna, salmon, yellowtail, scallop, snapper, spicy tuna, soft shell crab, shrimp, octopus, seared albacore  Step 4 - Mix Ins - Masago, red onion, white onion, cucumber, cilantro, pineapple, mango, organic tofu, tomato  Step 5 - Toppings (Unlimited) - Green onion, jalapeno, crispy onion, roasted garlic, tamago, kizami nori, bonito, sea salt, ginger, corn, tobiko, wasabi, shichimi  Mix in Sauces - (lots of styles, essentially a mix of different sauces) but they include Sesame oil, spicy mayo, spicy chili, sriracha, aloha, ponzu, shichimi, eel, yuzu ponzo, mango, guzzi, Korean spicy chili, wasabi mayo.   -----------------------  I had opt'ed for the lunch special and I was not completely hungry and I tend to not eat that much for the "first meal" of the day. My sushi burrito consisted of a seaweed wrap which had white rice added by a machine with a sprinkle of furikake. For some reason, I opted to have seaweed salad and spicy crab meat. They pile the sides on before getting a metal mixing bowl for your protein, mix in items, and sauces. As a salmon lover, I definitely went for salmon and added red onion, cucumber. Wasn't too familiar with the sauces but I opt'ed to try their "signature" poke poku style which consisted a mix of sesame oil, spicy mayo, spicy chili, sriracha, and aloha. Not sure what aloha is. Lol   What I didn't realize is for burritos, you cant get toppings cuz (for obvious reasons) you cant really put toppings on a burrito. Lol.. DANG IT (next time im getting a bowl LOL) They wrap it up and cut in half. If you dine in with the lunch special, they give you a small bowl of miso soup, and "access" to the house-made teas (but to be honest, cups are right next to it, I think anyone can get to it)   The ingredients they use are pretty good. My only complaint is too much sauce is used in the mix. Next time I may opted out or just pick a specific sauce or two to use. Made it quite messy to eat and sauce filled. Would like a more "natural" taste. Sauce seemed to cover a lot.   SIDE NOTE: one some of the side tables, they have Samsung QI's wireless charging pads for people to charge their phones while enjoying their meal.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J20zurZP01uY2NG1ypPKPQ.text: Poke Poku is one of the better poke bowl options- despite marketing themselves as Hawaiian, they've got the standard build-as-you-go format. PP stands out by having more add-on and mix-in options with a traditional slant, like roasted garlic, furikake seasoning, dried seaweed, tomato, bonito, and pineapple. They also have a variety of traditional-sounding teas available at the drink station, though I admittedly didn't care for the ones I tried.   Unlike most of the other poke bowl places, they have tofu and scallop as protein options. They get a bonus star for mixing the protein, veggies, and sauce by hand before putting them in the bowl. This seems obvious, but a lot of places just drizzle sauces on top or leave the bowl dry, and the marinated flavors are a big component of what i look for in a great poke bowl (americanized or otherwise).   There's free miso soup with dine-in. It's free, yes, but it's also possibly the worst miso soup I've ever had, because it had a distinct dishwater taste to it that made me think, "no wonder it's free." Definitely an area to improve upon, but one that's easy to overlook when your seating options include a giant indoor beach umbrella to turn your lunch break into a mental mini-vacation!

DU5PXwVy7EMJx6emHPEm7A.text: This used to be my favorite sushi burrito place. It would have gotten a 5 star rating but the management has suddenly put in weird rules.  Before I used to buy burritos for my whole family. My family loves them. So when we get to the end of ordering, I would ask for them to sprinkle on some of the extra garnishes in them to add flavor, color, and texture.  Suddenly out of nowhere, they stopped doing that. I tell them every single time that I am willing to pay for them. But now, they said that they're ordered not to by the owner and risk being fired.  NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: Please please please find a way for customers to GIVE YOU MORE MONEY. I don't know why you would make it hard for your customers to enjoy your delicious food. Customers are willing to pay for the toppings and garnishes you already have that are sitting there getting warm. It's ridiculous that bowls get them but the burritos don't. At least make it an option for us to pay for them.  I'd be happy to pay another buck or two to get what I want.  But now, I'm forced to go find other places where they would happily make customers what they want and appreciate my business.

u-tZljMkJdrn78E3KjG4rQ.text: I still have a few more local places to try, including a vaunted Hawaiian import (which is a bit like comparing apples to pears, but that's another story), but I'll just come out and say it: best poke bowl place I've tried so far.  Poke Poku is one of many similar restaurants on Rainbow Blvd that's trying to ride the latest fad. They're deep within a plaza next to Goodwill, and they're conveniently across the side street from beloved bubble tea shop Brew Tea Bar.  Poke Poku does bill itself as a "Hawaiian" poke restaurant, but it's still fashioned in the style of most poke bowl places in that you're assembling the product step-by-step a la Chipotle (but with seafood and typical ingredients):  "Start Here" - there are more options now than they had when I peeked in during their first week. You can choose from a poke bowl/salad, "Hawaiian Poke" (served without rice/greens), or sushi burrito (one size fits all). I went with a large poke bowl ($13.50 for 4 scoops of protein). There are also numerous appetizers available, but those only need to be ordered at the register.  Step 1 ("Base") - white rice, brown rice, mixed salad, baby kale, or a half and half mix of any of those. I stuck with the white rice.  The employee asked at this point if I wanted furikake, and I said yes. Why not have good seasoning, right?  Step 2 ("Sides") - pick two of the seaweed salad, edamame, crab meat, spicy crab meat, avocado, or fried shrimp tempura. I went for seaweed salad and shrimp tempura, and both were actually about as good as you'd expect. Extra sides available for $1.50  Step 3 ("Protein") - went with tuna, yellowtail, seared albacore, and salmon (after being informed that snapper was unavailable). Also available are bay scallop ,spicy tuna, soft shell crab, diced shrimp, and octopus, with extra proteins worth $1.75 each... hmm, maybe I should've tried to game them by doing a small bowl with two extra proteins?  "Sauce" (not an actual step): select from predesigned mixtures of sauces, or perhaps create your own out of what appeared to be a dozen different sauces. I went with the namesake Poke Poku Style, which was sesame oil, spicy mayo, spicy chili, sriracha, and something called Aloha sauce (note from a Hawaiian co-worker: if this is the shoyu brand, then the sauce has two key components of traditional poke). The end result did not taste too spicy, so don't worry about those labels unless you're ultra-sensitive.  Step 4 ("Mix-ins"): I went with masago, tomato, cilantro, mango, red onion. Other options include cucumber, lettuce, pineapple, and organic tofu. After this step, the employee will mix by hand the items from steps 3 through 4 (including sauce), so all of these get coated in sauces before being transferred to your actual bowl.  Step 5 ("Toppings"): I can see why some of these are separate, but I wouldn't have minded others being mixed evenly. I picked green onion, roasted garlic, tamago, kizami nori (shredded seaweed; note that they add a whole piece of nori to the bowl at the end anyway), corn, and tobiko. I probably should've added shredded bonito, and other toppings included jalapeno, crispy onion, sea salt, and ginger.  Then it's cash register time, where they'll place your bowl on a tray. They also offered a small complimentary miso soup, which was actually pretty delicious and not too salty, and pointed out some free drinks on the side including something slightly bitter made from burdock root, a so-called jasmine tea that was really just weak tea, and a roasted corn drink that somewhat resembles barley tea and which I easily chose after quickly taste-testing them all.  My poke bowl was just thoroughly delicious for whatever combination of reasons. Seasonings and sauces were certainly key, but all of the fish were fresh (albeit not necessarily high-quality) and weren't cut too finely as I've had at other places. The white rice isn't sushi rice, but it certainly was cooked properly. All of the assorted add-ons can be tasted individually and were also fresh.  My friend and I also tried the takoyaki ($3.99) out of curiosity. While it's advertised as 6 pieces, it's more like 8 half-pieces, and it oddly appeared to have been cooked after being sliced. They were crunchy and I found my tako reasonably tender, although the texture of the filling was a little overcooked compared to what I've eaten elsewhere.  Poke Poku is a little pricey, but their main product is the best I've had in its genre. I've been trying to evaluate this form of restaurant on its own merits, rather than directly compared to sushi or traditional poke, and I've found none better. I should also disclaim that I've only just started trying to trick out poke bowls fully to my liking, but this was superior to two places where I've fully customized my bowls.  P.S. I'm eagerly awaiting the opportunity to try their food again closer to Henderson. They're aiming for a Feb. 2016 opening on Eastern Avenue in the EOS Fitness / Monta Chaya plaza.

whAvqqcV_FtvUsmHVJQi_A.text: I ordered delivery from Poke Poku, through Yelp Eat24. I've never been to the restaurant in person.  I love poke, when it's made fresh and to order. No grocery slop that may have been sitting, dressed, for up to two days, yuch. I've only ordered from this establishment once, and I've only ordered two things, but the bowl was so extraordinarily good that I had to comment.  What I had: TAKOYAKI: A bit disappointing, but not surprising, considering that most Asian establishments in this town don't do it right. I may be overly critical; not only did I learn to eat TAKOYAKI when I lived in Japan, I lived in Osaka, the takoyaki capital. So I didn't subtract any stars   MEDIUM POKE BOWL: I don't really need to note the particular ingredients I chose for my bowl, save to say that everything was fresh and flavorful. You build your bowl from the bottom up, according to your taste, and the options are numerous! The tuna, while not prime quality ahi, was decent and cut bite-sized enough to cover any inherent flaws, like sinews. If you ordered the same amount of maguro nigiri at a sushi restaurant, you'd probably pay $80 and not get anything but the sushi; this bowl was only $13 and was delicious and full of extra yummies. Small and large bowls are available, too, to suit the size of your appetite.  The restaurant also offers poke salads, in case rice isn't, well, your bowl of rice. And sushi burritos, too, whatever THEY are (yes, I'm a genuine sushi snob!). I didn't see misoshiru on the menu, perhaps my eyes just passed it by.  I may not review this establishment again, but I will certainly order from here, again and again!

Toward the middle of the process she asked what mix ins I'd like with my protein choice, and I asked if they had avocado. She said yes we do, but it's a side. I asked her where it was because I couldn't see it. She was like oh it's over here and it's covered.  You can get that next time you come, or if you want it now, it'll be an extra dollar. IsVBkSpoty7dS8RMhGwhYA.text: There are a ton of these poke bowl/burrito places that have popped up in the last year and after trying all of them I have to say this place is my favorite. Very fresh fish and ingredients and really tasty sauces. I usually do a bowl with the poke poku sauce. Looking forward to trying the other sauces. Only improvement I can think of is that the line at dinner time is slow.

T2PCv64okF4eZEh_Jie8tQ.text: My favorite place to go whenever poke comes to my mind for Vegas. Customer service is always friendly. When dining in, miso soup is offered. During weekday lunch hours, they would have specials. You also get complimentary self-served teas to choose from.

myINd9HAxA5Lp547mrJLZQ.text: Let me start by saying I love this place. I went in today and was so disappointed. First, the service was beyond slow. Second, the music playing was extremely vulgar. And last and most importantly, the young man making my bowl must have been new.  He didn't ask if I wanted furikake on my rice.  I asked for it and ponzu sauce on my rice.  The scoops of crab were skimpy and the scoop of tuna was less than half full. I come in here often and this was the first time that I feel like I didn't get my money's worth. So sad!

1UifRo6IdqdqpWVVI0lG-A.text: Normally I like you guys a lot but I just ordered food from you through postmates and it was completely wrong. I ordered a large poke salad. 2 scoops tuna 1 yellowtail and 1 salmon with seaweed salad, crab meat, etc. I got my order and it one had rice in it (i could excuse the rice btw i just wont eat it) but you gave me spicy everything! Spicy Crab meat and spicy tuna with no seaweed salad. It's inedible for me at this point because one I cant eat rice and two i can't eat very spicy things because I have stomach ulcers. Theres barely any greens and nothing much for me to eat at all.. i got half a refund from postmates for this but with how little i could actually eat of it it wasnt worth the remainder amount I paid. Again i could excuse the rice but i dont understand how my order was messed up this bad.

UHCV3I2m1r40YVjWOhr_EQ.text: There are several poke restaurants within 5 miles of this one so its easy to skip over, especially since its hidden in a not-so-busy plaza. I'm so glad I finally decided to try this one though because it is now my favorite! The setup is pretty much the same as other spots. You choose a bowl size or you can do a burrito. Then you choose some sides, some protein, and unlimited toppings. What I liked the most was the sauce selections. The portions are also very good. The small gets two large scoops of protein for about $10.   Staff was super friendly and the hawaiian themed decor is very cute. My new favorite poke joint!

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not so &#34;Small&#34; poke salad. Lots of toppings!
Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium bowl of yummy poke goodness

Z6ZkpwnpM22YQDarLU3-Mg.text: With a ton of poke spots popping up around Vegas, I'd say Poke Poku falls a bit short. Its located on a busy busy street, but I didn't have a hard time with parking. Clean, with a lot of seating. I like how they have lunch specials like a poke burrito which I got for $6. Prices here are a bit higher than other places. I think a medium bowl with 3 scoops was around $11-12 which is the same price as a large bowl else where. While the fish looked fresh, they didn't have that many options for toppings.   I got my salmon burrito to go. I liked how they have a machine that automatically makes a rice sheet with a push of a button! But... I did find hair in my rice. I also think they should have avocado slices so that the avocado mash doesn't make the burrito mushy. My fish was unevenly distributed so on one half of my burrito, there were only 3 pieces of salmon and the other half had the majority. The burrito is a bit smaller than other places as well... not sure if thats due to the lack of topping choices so I only chose cucumber, onions, crab meat and avocado with my salmon.

Jv74TId1RfOWo8Jwo4fqKQ.text: In all honesty, I really like the food here. It's delicious! The customer service is similar to the character portrayed by Bon Qui Qui. Amusing nonetheless. I'm kind of an addict to the point where I've actually gone through four loyalty stamp cards (buy 10 get one free), and just got the 7th stamp on my 5th card. I discovered this restaurant in October 2018. So, you get it. The reason I cannot bring myself to give Poke Poku four, or even five stars, is that the customer service is okay, and seriously, they are always out of avocados, like, ALWAYS; and I'm not talking about after the lunch rush either. I realize that's an expensive ingredient, so if you're always "out", just take it off the menu. So, all-in-all, yes, I enjoy the poke bowls here, but I'd enjoy it so much more if my favorite ingredient was kept in-stock. A small bowl is definitely more than enough food for one person.

9tpbAYy9kF1M6n7ozyq27g.text: This place used to be amazing but I'm not sure what's going on lately. I always order online and go in to pick up. The last three times it's like they're just free styling your order. It'll be completely missing things or have things added that you didn't request. Not only that the wait time will say close to an hour for pickup. It's a sushi burrito for Christ sake, how does the time estimate say 55 minutes! Normally I don't complain but after 3 mess ups I feel it's necessary.

1pwFPNfA-PCrj1u42Crh4w.text: If I could I would give this place a negative rating but since I can't 1 star it is. The list of issues follows.   Issue #1 - it took 20 Mins for 2 employees to serve 4 customers that were before me. I mean come on it's not a social hour want to chitchat do it outside of work. Issue #2- the guy that was behind the counter nicely took his hat of ran his fingers through his hair then continued to carry a convo about his hair and how he needs a hair cut. I mean gross. You're working with food. Especially raw fish. I don't want any of those or any germs in my food. Keep going- after he was done helping the customers instead of taking the next customer he gets on his phone to call his "boss" all while behind the counter. ( should apologize to the people that have been waiting now for 25-30 Mins and go to the back if you're going to get on your phone with a long line of annoyed customers waiting)  Ok so finally he gets off the phone serves a person in front of me. Yes he washed his hands but pay attention to this - Instead of using a paper towel or something to dry his hands he wipes them on his shirt. Disgusting.  So finally it was my turn. ( not with him but the girl that had gloves on and was somewhat appropriately doing her job) - I ordered a burrito- wanted yellowtail for my protein. She informs me they're out. So basically I wasted 30 mins of my time for nothing.   Never coming back to this place again. Guys if you need to get poke go to sweet poke down the street on rainbow and windmill- great customer service and the cleanliness of the location and it's employees isn't questionable.  Shame on you Poke POKU.   Sincerely,  Pissed off customer.

xwRS2IC_4NfYVVyClrHJwQ.text: Hello can someone please contact me about the poor customer experience I've had today with my food. I would not like to post pictures of what I found. Tried to call Nelson and this location and I cannot get through.

XbxlPZF2XRbu4znVXniz4w.text: We ordered from Postmates- which lets you track your order. It said it'd take about 25-30 minutes for delivery and it ended up taking 30 minutes for them to just prepare the order. It was good food though, tasted fresh and had our orders correct. Just bummed that it took 30 minutes for poke bowls to be prepped at 3:00 pm. But again, the food is tight.

5E7dA_YHcjOjcNCMOGncnw.text: Easy to order, fast casual. Prices are reasonable and they have more than just poke, but appetizers and ramen for a great price too! Their portions are huge. I ordered an XS salad and had plenty leftover for lunch the next day.

sssf1ueoqdEamliiMfQRtQ.text: Amazing costumer service with incredible food. Prices are just right. Make sure to try the LA Style sauce for your bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NOtlM_uSFh_oBsQN53ii6Q.text: This has to be my favorite poke place in Las Vegas. It's my GO TO. The fish is always fresh and portion size is great. The staff is very friendly and my family and I will continue going here. Love love this place!

3P6FXvthzqOJj65TYT7Mlg.text: I have practically been a regular at this Poke Poku location since they opened their doors. Unfortunately, their service has gone completely downhill. What used to be a welcome and enjoyable weekly experience was completely ruined last night when my family and a guest from out of town went in to place our orders. The entire experience was unacceptable, and we regret not walking out when we had the chance. Even worse, the place that we had raved about to our guest was not at all representative of what it used to be.  The workers (all of which were new faces that we weren't familiar with) were undeniably rude. They spent more time carrying a conversation with each other than they did paying attention to their paying customers. When I ordered an extra small bowl, I was told that I was only allowed one side, when just last week I was told that I could pick two. Nowhere was it explicitly stated that an extra small only comes with one side. Additionally, when we asked for an extra side, we were met with irritated sighs because it's apparently such a chore to add that to our purchase total. The workers saw fit to rush us through the process of creating our bowls, but weren't actually attentive when we spoke. Our guest didn't even have time to order exactly what she wanted because the worker was being so rude. She missed out on the soft shell crab, and after she tried some of mine, she was livid that the worker who "helped" her had ruined her experience and didn't take the time to walk her through the steps of building her bowl as a new customer. We ordered 6 bowls altogether, and when they asked if we (as customers) were a group and if we planned on paying together, we were met with more rude and irritated attitude. Once we completed our purchase, the worker had the audacity to ask if we needed bags for our SIX bowls. Furthermore, the restaurant was nowhere near as clean as it used to be with the previous workers that we knew and were familiar with. There were at least four people working, and yet there was trash piled up, the bar was covered in spilled sauce, one of the menu screens was broken, and the workers made audible jokes about how the floor was sticky behind the counter. Also, one of the workers saw fit to use explicit language right in front of customers with children. My family loves the food here, but I'm sad to say that our favorite spot for poke is a thing of the past. We'll try our luck at the Eastern location, but we won't be returning here.

g0FLP9K7m8AGSY5rEmj9Uw.text: A hole in the wall! My phone was getting repaired next door and had to wait about an hour and a half so within walking distance my son and I decided to check it out-  I had the sushi burrito with crab and he had the ramen . It was really good and my son loved the soup! We also ordered takoyaki on the side and it was amazing!

EExlBXxf_cOfKsCumrgOPg.text: Another poke place in Las Vegas! I wanted to go to one that allowed me to get as many toppings without surcharges.   We came during weekend lunch and it wasn't busy, couldn't order the specials since it was only for weekday specials.   The employees were nice and friendly. I got a poke bowl with half salad half brown rice! Topped it up with almost everything they offered. The fish were really fresh. The many different type of sauces gets really confusing. I just mixed like 5 together, and it tasted pretty good!   The free brewed tea for eating in was really interesting! Could taste the infused barley, and corn.   The poke bowl had so many flavours, so many toppings, I was like in heaven. Each bite was a new experience with different flavours depending on the toppings on my spoon.   I wanted to come back the next day, but was flying out already :(  Can't wait to come back!   I forgot to use the yelp check in discount! Was too overwhelmed with excitement when I first went in!

ehOqnM2vwG6Xyhx5trsXwA.text: Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for months. Came in today for their $5 sushi burrito special. It should have included 1 scoop protein, Mochi ice cream, healthy waters and miso soup if you dined in. Even at 7pm, place was packed. Line took longer due to the cashier serving food. The burrito itself is small compared to other places but not bad for $5. I'm the burrito itself was delicious. Fish was fresh and it had great flavor. They failed to give us the mochi ice cream and honestly we forgot to ask for it.   Overall, place was nice, clean and busy. I would definitely recommend this place and we would definitely come back.

m7VGn9JW0vek9FbaFJaA0g.text: The food is great the service from the manager is rude ... he said there was no salmon ( I only wanted one scoop)I looked over I saw salmon enough for 4 scoops.. so I told him salmon please and he looked annoyed   After that one of his employees something something to him and he said I know how to do my job don't confuse me and I felt so bad for her she was very nice. He looked mad throughout the whole thing not coming back to this location.

k5UQL_azf1d7os8rdA10fw.text: Stellar customer service! I never have a bad experience when I go.   I recently saw the "coming soon" poke cupcakes and knew that I HAD to have it for my husband's birthday. I messaged them about it and they were willing to put in a special order for me. The flavors were fantastic!

Ej_wqrD6D5woRoTIaVODhA.text: First off, I'm a Cali girl visiting some family in Vegas. I was craving poke and saw this place on Postmates and decided to give it a try. I simultaneously looked up their reviews on yelp and was assured by their 4.5 star rating that my decision was good so far. Looking at their menu was amazing.They offer sooooo much more then the normal poke places I frequent out in Cali.  They have Tobiko, Tamago, Bonito, Snapper, Soft shell crab, and a few others. Anywho, I ordered through postmates and could wait to try. 40 minutes later my postmate driver delivered to the wrong house and I never got my dinner. I quickly got a credit through postmates and decided to order my large poke powl again. (White rice, 4 fish (salmon, double scallops, and spicy tuna) spicy crab meat, seaweed salad, green onion, garlic, cucs, ginger, wasabi, jalapeno, tamago, furikake and a few other, the kitchen sink basically. Lol. New postmate driver found my house and dropped off my bowl. Side note: I had put in the special instructions on postmates that my original order was never delivered as an fyi. I opened my bag and there was a note from the staff that put my order together on my bowl. It said "sorry about the delivery mishap, hope you got a refund. I added an extra scoop of salmon for you". How cool is that? Major points and so courteous. Customer service was next level. I called to thank them and the lady told me it was a worker by the name of Steven I believe. You guys rock. Oh, and the ingredients in this bowl were unbelievably fresh. The rice was a lil warm and not cold and dry like the other poke places. Everything was perfect. Please go get this food. Especially the location on Rainbow Blvd. I know I'll be back again next time I visit.

_5qDhPe9L69RY2gfFqjy6w.text: So many Poke joints within 2 mile radius. Competition was hot and not all were winning. Poke Poku won Monkey over easily, while others have disappeared.   I think it's all about the choices and amounts of fish.  Monkey usual was a Medium bowl(3 proteins) with half brown rice half salad, soft shell crab, double Salmon, Korean sauce and all the fixins. Now sans the rice, a Medium Salad is a huge box of greens plus all the above.   Friends who have tried other Poke joints and disliked Poke overall because of them, changed their tunes here. You're welcome. This my go to spot for Poke. I don't want it anywhere else. Poke Poku nailed down the value in its pricing, punch card and free delicious teas while dining in. Staff is always friendly, patient and kind. Great environment.   Monkey do often.

kjyCsxTOtlfrnClXsDA6Eg.text: Great place for a poke bowl. Fun friendly staff,  island atmosphere, fresh ingredients. Alot of places are afraid of sauces...Not here and I am a sauce person. To top it of free miso soup and a sheet of seaweed. Great flavors and prices it's worth a try

rVcXCD7Vzp--kaKj9UjiDw.text: This place offers poke bowl, takoyaki (octopus balls), dumpling and more. They are very generous with their ingredients. Even a small bowl is enough for me. Free complementary tea and miso soup if you dine in!

ARCK75fxTfBeNVyvwy8A9g.text: First time visit.  I was really impressed. Friendly & very clean atmosphere. I got a large bowl and was walked through the entire building process. Large portions and the fish and seafood looked and tasted very fresh.  I will definitely be back.  If you dine in you also get a free bowl of Miso soup:)

HCFHD-FrMFvoJjKgzF22mQ.text: Second time here. This review is pretty much based on the service I received. I'm happy to have gotten the server/cashier that I had when ordering my food this time. (Tuesday,8-22-17, approx. 7:15 in the evening). I informed her I was a vegetarian, and she said she was actually vegan, and she could help me with ordering my burrito. I told the last girl when I was there that I was a strict vegetarian (and no fish or seafood) and she didn't bother to tell me that the sauce I ordered contained fish eggs. (Found that out tonight when this lovely young lady informed me). She was patient with me, and even let me know that some items were fried in the same oil/vat as the shrimp tempura, etc. She made sure my burrito was full to my liking (since basically everything in it was vegetables) and was super friendly. I don't know why I never think to get people's names when I'm complimenting them until after I've left, and this case is no exception. Wish I'd have gotten her name in case a manager or owner reads this review.

GlpuBmRu4yCgyN2trwFpEA.text: This place is soooo yummy! I love all their Mix-ins and toppings. So many choices. Best poke place in Vegas. A little expensive but I guess that's the price to get such fresh tasting fish out to the desert!  thank god its kind of far from us to keep me from going too often!

ltuu1JNkKLYdl03xs-t3iA.text: Im wow'd at this poke place. Great service and great food. They have a very good selection on each addition, base, protein, mixings and sauce. I like the softshell crab mux, its perfect for the bowl. Clean and comfortable dine in. Cant say enough, its a must to check out!

Ro81PrwXAlWq3_g2edfdLQ.text: Worst freaking service. Took forever just to place order and when I finally did the guy rushed through my order so fast that it was so sloppy not to mention he didn't get it right. Will never recommend to anyone

Z_wwPjWmeN1YtCHgu9iDuw.text: Great place to get a Poke Bowl or Salad. Great portion size! Customer service was great!

db_E8YDn6-dru-byNc_ONQ.text: Honestly the best poke place on the main land. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. The food is fresh and just stop reading this and go there already...worth every penny!!!

EwHdkWWNObKOMUUpoYgGpQ.text: I had an excellent meal Here today.  They have 5 different steps from r the perfect poke bowl/salad/burrito.  You get a base, 2 sides, 2 proteins, 5 items to mix in and 12 different toppings.  On top of this culinary creation you get an option of 9 different sauces from around the world to further enhance your taste buds.  I used the Korean sauce using a spicy chili sauce called gochujang.  Apparently this restaurant started in Hawaii, opened up some in LA and now are opening up multiple locations here in vegas.  The gentleman behind the bar was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  He made suggestions which turned out to be very helpful and crazy tasty.  Will be back soon.  This is real Poke

iyMdNPCUIt8c7WiZVYHo_Q.text: Really Really Really impressed with this place!!! This was my first time getting a poke bowl and the guy that helped me knew it. He walked me through the entire process. Fantastic customer service! Will definitely recommend and be back! Keep up the awesome work guys!

CLXgNHZShVBaULuMLYC47A.text: Love this place. Tasty and fresh food and very clean restaurant. Employees greet you with smile and help you with suggestions.

cV1_DLzSY-hG_AfTKcynmQ.text: Great poke bowls. Very fresh ahi and lots of toppings choices as well as a dozen different sauce options. A lot of free toppings and good prices. Mmmmmm

czVRAPDk2uOjb-IaNH1-yQ.text: Very good experience.  Lots of toppings.  Helpful staff.  Menu is fairly easy to read.  The space inside is a little clunky.  I enjoyed it overall.  Will return.

DxGnNCt-MexiVLvfiWczxA.text: Fresh food, lots of options, delicious sauce, and great service. Love all the bonuses you get with dining in.

Fln3-jGGEwai30qnnJw-UA.text: This place was the bomb diggity! Hopefully they can expand to different locations. Service was fast and easy. They also have free wifi which really gives the place a nice vibe to eat in, played music which also made eating enjoyable, I would gladly eat there again anytime!

6eeZkrHRDMrsbIQ9Ln7Ysw.text: Every time I eat here I'm always afraid my tongue is going to punch a hole in the roof of my mouth, give my brain a hug and throw a party! So eat here at your own risk! HEAVEN IN A BOWL!!!! The service is amazing, the tuna is out of this world and the large $13 bowl can feed two easy!  I'm a dietary vegan and I eat fish a couple times a month, so have no fear if you are vegan they will set you up right!!! It is rare as a vegan that you go out to eat and find anything palatable. Oh my! Forget that noise! They pile it high give you extra yummy topping choices in place of your proteins and they have tofu!!!! YUMMY!!!!!! Now after writing this review I don't care that it's almost 8 at night I'm ordering in some Poke Poku!!! Woot Woot!!! I may have a mild addiction!   (BTW if you're ordering in as a vegan call them and tell them what you want and they'll tell you what to do)

zjVKiIj4y9Zl7il0MbgS4g.text: My favorite Poke place in Vegas among the many poke spots that have popped up recently in Vegas. The fish is fresh and the workers are very informative. They even let you try out the sauces and combination sauces if you have any questions about them.  You essentially make your own bowl similar to Chipotle. First you choose your base-white rice, brown rice, greens, or half and half. Then you choose your sides, choice of protein, toppings, and sauce. There are preset combination sauces that have already been concocted for you. Feel free to ask the worker which sauce goes best with the items that you have chosen. The restaurant is decorated Hawaiian style with lei and umbrella decor with ample seating. There is even a small kiddie table for the kids to sit at! Three different kinds of complimentary tea is served. Definitely coming back here again and again!

E-WMx5pmvUxWeScHPER_OQ.text: I honestly don't know what was better; the food or the staff that served me tonight. I got the 4 protein salad and the staff was just so friendly it really helped after a rough day.

qp1ao-wqzY4FXNyyX7PA0g.text: Good portion sizes, good quality choices of seafood, toppings, sauces and extras plus the staff was  pretty cool as well.  The next time we are in Vegas we will stop by Poke Puku again!

MP05z-xOBvR8C6M3C7Ebfg.text: This place is SO good.  This should be the standard for all Poke restaurants, seriously, it really should.  If there was a Poke Poku in Eugene, Oregon I would go every day as we are desperately in need of good Poke.  They have all the topping, good protein, so many options and I love that you get a little extra thing like shrimp tempura here on your bowl.  Also, free Miso Soup and they have the best mango soda that I bought extras to take home with me.  This place is the gold standard.  I have traveled across the whole country stopping at every Poke place I saw or was within driving distance too (I LOVE IT) and this place was just the best.  I hope it becomes a far reaching chain.  It deserves to and if I had the money I would be opening Poke Poku everywhere I could.  Amazing, amazing, amazing...  amazing.

6fG0Og84VVQOwfkNOgEA0A.text: Do have to say this place found a way to stand out above the rest.  Food is fresh and tasty.  Bowls are huge and filling.  But it's the selection and variety of toppings that makes this place...just like 5 Guys where there's more toppings than you know what to do with, here with the Poke bowl, you can create unlimited combinations of food.  I really hope they last as I'll be come back.  Only suggestion, bigger cups for water please.

CduRa1-ARF26RPcnmCnO9A.text: Very good poke !!! They are very generous with the fish other places they put alot of rice and greens & no fish you also get a free miso if you eat I love this place !!!

N7nEUT1V4lT_Lwy2cMsZuw.text: I do quite like this place. I've only gotten the sushi burritos from there, so I don't really know much about the rest of the menu. So when you go, expect loud music and cold chairs. That's probably the only things I would change. Oh wait, I forgot about the inconsistency of the sizes of the burritos too. I tend to get something similar each time, but the sizes can vary to "eh, I'm still a bit hungry" to "oh-ho-hooo this thing is so thicc (WITH TWO C'S) I don't think I can finish this!".   The quality of the fish itself is pretty good. They tend to be cut in smaller pieces so you get a better ratio throughout. Something I want to try though is to ask them to mix the seaweed salad in with the bowl that they  mix the sauces, toppings, and fish in. I need to keep that in mind for next time I go. The amount of choices you get is pretty good as well. You have the option for brown or white rice, you can do a sushi cheeto burrito (hot or original, I recommend the original), and you have a nice spread of things you can toss in there as well. They do have tamago, but they won't stick it in the burrito. Completely understandable because you wouldn't be able to close it at all.  Something else I like about this place is their free water station. I remember a barley tea and a roasted corn water, but I'm pretty sure there are one or two more. I think it's a nice thing to add on since soda can be too heavy of a drink to go with the meals they provide. They have reasonable lunch specials and if you eat in you get free miso soup. I will never argue with free. Every once in a while they will have promotions they show on Facebook where they'll  include some dessert of some sort or another appetizer with the meal. It's pretty cool. I'm looking forward to their new location in the NW side of town!

nGioVXVkOGoNeXTf4P-O0Q.text: I love this place. I have tried several popular Poke places around town but this is by far my favorite place! I come here a couple times of month. They have great sauces, toppings and good sushi grade fish! I usually get friendly customer service and never have to wait too long to be served.

LStV5XMQV4WmnEymr-x33w.text: The food is okay maybe just what I got I didn't love it. But the service is amazing.! It's not like fine dining but they treat you like it. They even walk around asking if you would like anything if they can get you anything while you dine in. Free miso soup and free flavored iced tea when you dine in and free WiFi. Nice lunch spot before I took Jae to lol kids club

q2kYJZ9VsCovq3e2DgZtEg.text: Clean Asian fusion! Delicious and healthy!                  Great lunch or dinner spot. Definitely recommend.

HE4EHjjqRa7IrpCI8JqeXA.text: I am a regular at Poke Poku and LOVE this place. They allow you to mix everything together so you can make authentic style poke rather than throwing everything in a bowl and the sauce on top. The staff is super friendly! Definitely a must go if you're in the south west area.

ke5V-QrIKSB1MhzoZAvbtw.text: I ordered a Medium bowl which is 2 scoops of protein. The protein servings are pretty hefty here which is great. Fish tasted fresh. Service was awesome.   It is a little pricier compared to their competitors in the same area. The toppings are pretty limited to only a couple things and then you gotta pay $1 or something per extra topping. This is what makes it more expensive. For the same price, you can get unlimited toppings at the other Poke shops on the same block.   Spicy Crab meat tasted too Mayonaisse-y.  I'd come back again for their fresh ahi.

LW1nAewnnqzFfylZWeg3CA.text: My absolute favorite Poke place in town! The fish is very fresh.  I like to choose a different sauce mix depending on the protein combo I choose for that day.  It keeps it interesting. Free brewed tea is a nice touch as well.  Definitely worth repeat visits!

5u6Ls3Oavi9pIy2DbtPqvQ.text: Bomb is all I can say.  Brought someone here who never has tried this type of food before and they loved it also.  I also like you can pick the size you want.

Uk3LJXNt-uVAOQeg0sKQYA.text: Ordered a large bowl, it was plenty of food! The portions here are perfect.... some poke bowl places over do the rice and then you have a lot of rice left over.   The soft shell crab was amazing!! Best part of the bowl for sure! So many sides to choose from very pleased with the selection.   Free miso soup if you dine in! And some out of this world miso soup at that!!!!   We will be back for sure!

Lus_mU-7tvWpflNVO3c7qw.text: If you're looking for poke bowls and have a hard time choosing (considering they're popping up on every corner now) this place trumps them all!   Just stopped in for the first time last night! I'm beyond impressed! Beautifully designed, extremely personable and helpful staff, lots of specials.  Their approach to creating poke bowls are unique and stand out in comparison to the typical build your own poke bowls/sushi burritos all over town (you'll have to just head over and see for yourself what I'm talking about). Their portions are huge (ordered a medium and barely made a dent in mine), quality of food is great (their brown rice was cooked to perfection which surprisingly a lot of people get wrong and their sauces actually had great flavor! I find a lot of places sauces to be super bland), got a free miso soup for dining in (which was so yummy), and they even have freshly brewed herbal iced teas COMPLIMENTARY that are so amazing!! I had the jasmine tea.  Unfortunately they're located in a somewhat out of sight view and not so noticeable if you were to pass by. Hoping the word of mouth with bring this great place some business!  Thanks to the staff for making our first visit so great! We'll definitely be back!

cNEX8hbf2n5ASFNVF7ayGg.text: We were hooked on poke during our last visit to the Big Island. We lunched today on the Hawaiian Bowl and it was the best since Kona--although we weren't used to all the decisions. The young man serving us was great and unhurried. Also picked some Takoyaki which were made on the spot. He told us this was a California chain soon to have four outlets in LV.

MRutATXxQLt9WSDmyFeKJQ.text: Love this place!! This is my go to for lunch or any of my poke cravings. I usually go for the salad bowl with the LA Style sauce. I'd highly recommend Poke POKU :)

egIXRpLA5K88-TJj4Gwxzw.text: Great food I mean awesome stuff here at this poke spot.  The service is less to be desired, there are 3 people behind the counter with a line that doesn't move.  One girl does everything while the others watch as it takes 30 min for me to get my food.  Figure it out.. this is not hard nor time consuming - Put fish in bowl and serve.

Du1kp2inFxEzbnjJnc_0jA.text: I love this place. It is near my work and I eat here probably once a week. The medium sized poke bowl gives you 3 protein choices and is a lot of food. I can't imagine ever needing a large size. The fish has always been fresh and delicious. The sauces are great.   The poke bowls here are the best I've found in Las Vegas, and easily on par (or better) than places I've been to in Seattle (where I first started trying poke bowls). They also have a stamp card you can get to earn a free poke bowl (after 10 stamps).   Of the 20+ bowls I've eaten from here I've had two misfires. Once, the rice was stale. Another time the sauce tasted off, for whatever reason. Even with the misfires the poke bowls were still good, just not usual amazingness that I had come to expect.   Really, my only complaint here is that sometimes there will be a line of people which can end up taking 15-20 minutes to clear through. I usually come by during lunch and don't have 20 minutes to burn standing in line. They need to figure out a better system to crank through customers when it is busy. If they can nail that, this place would be perfect.

1pL4kNUEYCE_4eOPumTNLA.text: I cannot even begin to say how much I love this place! Lol It is my absolute favorite. I probably eat here every week! No, but honestly this is my favorite poke place I have ever come across. The food is amazing. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The line is super long during lunch but I mean it's not like you can avoid that, this poke place is so good.

_NnFNDTFQEaO-rkfHcKIZg.text: Absolutely awesome poke. Huge portion for only $11.50 and it comes with free miso soup if you dine in. They have an awesome toppings list! And the ability to get 2 free sides is huge. Free avocado?!?!Clean and the staff were welcoming and friendly.  This place is a winner for sure. Keep the positive reviews coming so they stay open!

f_idXxO19_fvFJV61D-95A.text: Oh my goodness, Poke Poku! I was so eager to try this poke out, that naturally I forgot to take a picture of my beautiful food. Next time I will for sure! I'm not a Poke expert by any means, but I believe this spot gave me the will to become one...I know, sounds cheesy lol.   Seriously, everything was delicious! I tried a rice bowl with half and half white and brown rice with 3 scoops protein: yellowtail, salmon, and spicy tuna with the LA style sauce. For the sides/toppings I chose: spicy crab, seaweed salad, the sweet egg patty (forgot the name), roasted garlic, red onion, red and orange fish eggs, green onion, futikake, seaweed strips, tomato, mango, and probably some other stuff I can't recall. They have so many tasty options and everything is fresh and prepared right in front of you. I also ordered a Spicy Ramen and the steamed Dumplings which were both on special for $4.99! Both very hot and tasty as well :) I know it sounds like I really pigged out, but really, I DID! Although I shared my ramen and dumplings, I still could not manage to finish my medium bowl because they really do load it up. I had enough leftovers for a snack the following day, so that's always exciting! The food is absolutely excellent, the employees are friendly, the atmosphere has a positive vibe, it's clean, and they offer free Jasmin, barley, and corn tea. I can't wait to go back again!  UPDATE 06/09: Came in for late night dinner. I noticed that I didn't get a little stamp card the first time I came in, so I asked Ralph if they could stamp my new card for last time I went in and he was totally cool with it! Once you get 10 stamper-oos you get a medium poke bowl for $0!! Thanks for being so chill, Ralph! Awesome customer service!   Also, I just noticed that they advertise coupons on the back of Smith's grocery receipts so be sure to keep an eye out!

b-GyAhnMgwe9gZnTQk8g_Q.text: My 3 year old and I dinned in last night and as usual  my poke bow was amazing! I've never had a bad experience with a bowl or salad. The downfall is that a few changes have been made and even though the price dropped the large bowl is 3 scoops of fish instead of the 4 it used to be.   What continues to make me sad is that they don't offer any sauce with any of their fried items. I come here purposely because my kid likes the fried stuff but he also likes sauce and I don't know of anywhere else that serves calamari without a sauce. Odd.   Lastly, while we were dining in the music wasn't the edited version. F bombs were blaring away. Luckily my kid didn't notice and the parents with a younger kid behind me didn't seem to notice either but eventually someone will make a big stink about this.   I'll keep coming back but I'll be ordering to go and possibly won't be ordering the fried food

CC0vx0G7-K9bjGLxRXTS7Q.text: Addicted to poke. Love how they have seared albacore! Love how they offer ramen and other Asian appetizers such as gyoza. The staff are friendly and helpful, and food amazing. The only reason why I gave 4 stars and not 5 is because they were a bit understocked when I went. No coconut water, no cheeto burrito, low on sriracha etc. The seating area also looks a bit small and not well kept.

IGufcgpiGMztlIePrkbTqg.text: They play K-POP, can't go wrong! No seriously...  What did I get I got a small salad with 2 proteins and got the yellowtail and the salmon. I chose to have mine tossed with no sauce, cause I don't like my fish to be saucy, then topped it off with some random stuff. Got soy sauce on the side. IT WAS GREAT! They were big portions! And I was stuffed! There are a lot of toppings to chose from to be tossed with the fishes and then top your bowl off.  Environment The restaurant was on a strip plaza. Easy to find. There is a ice cream place next door, great way to end the meal! If its your first time, you may need to take your time to read the menu, but it is very simple. There is specialty sauces they have that they will toss with your fish, but you are always welcome to mix your own stuff together! Your choice! There is teas to the side that are free! Barley, Jasmine and regular.  Niceness of Staff She was really really nice. It was my first time there and she took the time to explain things to me. I decided to do the bowl but because I wanted vegetables, she recommended I do the salad plate so it holds more! Yay! Thanks for the help!  Dollar $ I would consider this very inexpensive and tasty. Especially for fish, it is hard to get good quality for a reasonable price. I am definitely happy with the meal!  Yes? Absolutely! I would definitely go here again. Especially if I am trying not to eat rice, these are the salads I rather have!   #WendyTakesVegas #WendyWanders

B8hEVQbI_XbHW6llwIqM9g.text: Out of all the poke choices on Rainbow, I really believe that Poke Poku has the best options and portions for their price. Servers are friendly and there's plenty of seats. Not only do they serve poke bowls but like every other poke place you can turn it into a burrito or salad bowl. They have items like hot Cheetos burrito, ramen, takoyaki, gyoza..the list goes on.   Now what I like to do when I order from here is order a Small bowl with rice then add extra protein. It's extra but who doesn't want more fish. Fish is pretty fresh from the looks and taste of it whenever I've gone in. They also have so many add-ons to choose from as well as pre-made sauces to go into your poke bowl/burrito/salad.   They also offer a variety of teas to go with your meal. Free of charge! Corn tea was interesting. But I prefer the barley.   It's located in the same plaza as Good Will and is next to the Dollar Tree. Don't forget to ask for your miso soup when you dine-in. Another plus is that they have punch cards :)

DhnoUJQhDUenolN0LvD3sQ.text: Poke poku has great quality fish. It's fresh and cut in larger pieces so it's similar to Hawaiian poke. It's a poke bar so you can pick and chose what you want in your bowl or burrito. They give you options of white or brown rice or salad and you can top it with anything you want.   For my burrito I got it with salmon and yellowtail and tossed it in the poke poku sauce. It's their signature sauce but they have a bunch of different options as well. I topped mine with cucumbers spicy crab, avocado, corn and Masago. The flavors were spot on.  They also put fried garlic and furikake on top of the rice so it adds great flavor and texture.   I can't wait to go back and try the bowls!

fZfU57XTLddvpuQRHOww_w.text: I got a few missed call from my friend Leo. So I texted him asking "what's up?"  Turns out he wanted to know if I have had lunch already.  It was like 2pm, but I managed to miss lunch while studying for a TAM card exam, plus procrastinating on Facebook and also watched a few Tasty Japan videos.   Apparently it is also Poke Poku's One Year Anniversary and they are offering complimentary appetizer sampler and dessert with your entree order all day this weekend (Oct 21 & 22).  Sounds good to me!  I love having foodie friends that help keep me in the loop for these promos.  And if you check-in on Facebook, you get 10% off your order.  Mochi Ice Cream Free - Green Tea or Red Bean (I suggest you eat this first, mine was melted by the time I finished my large poke salad) 3pcs of Goyza Free 3pcs of Shrimp Shumai Free 5pcs of Calamari Free Miso Soup Free (Dine-in Only) And Healthy Water- always on the house (3 varieties of iced brewed tea)  As far as Poke goes, it is NOT traditional Hawaiian style, in spite of the restaurant's name. Brah, if that is exactly what you're craving for, then you will be disappointed. Come on, even the Poke occasionally sold at select LV Costco locations are more authentic. No stink talk intended. Just laying some truth. I will also not say SoCal or Korean fusion version of Poke are not also grinds. (double negatives, so it is GRINDS!) Actually it is quite popular on the West Coast and made its way to Las Vegas.  In fact there seems to be a "Poke" bowl or sushi burrito eatery open on every block in this SW part of town.  While waiting for the 4 people ahead of me in line placing their orders, I distracted myself posting pictures to Instagram Story and snapping a few more pictures for Yelp and Facebook check-in.  Leo said I waited a long time, but I didn't really noticed.  And I also did not utilized my time more wisely studying the menu, so I ended up ordering a large salad and then haphazardly picked the other items (I don't want to be that guy taking forever with the order and pissing off the people patiently waiting behind me) to complete my order.  So ended up with the following mad creation: (Step 1) Mixed Salad (Step 2) Seaweed Salad + Fried Shrimp Tempura (pass on this next time) (Step 3) Salmon + Scallop + Yellowtail + Seared Albacore (Step 4) Everything (but they skipped on the Pineapple, Mango and Organic Tofu) (Step 5) Everything, except Jalapeno + Sea Salt And for someone that does not particularly like spicy food, I went with Gangster Style for the Sauce option (Sesame Oil + Spicy Chili + Sriracha + Spicy Chili +  Spicy Chili + Spicy Chili). Next time I will be sure to read the menu first than survey the premises with keepsake photos.   Anyway, the portion is generous and although I paid $13.15 for a large salad (with the 10% FB check-in discount), I still felt it was a reasonable deal. Plus they gave me a fried appetizer sampler and Mochi Ice Cream to celebrate their One Year Anniversary.   Today may be my first visit, but for sure it will not be the last.  I still have 9 more sauces to try.  So HAAAAPPPPY One Year ANNIVERSARY POKE POKU!!! And best of luck in the opening of the next two locations in the Ninth Island.

laqYiYRDQiho3VVFZ8OLrw.text: I have been a regular for quite some time, coming in at least once a week. This used to be my favorite place but the service has completely gone down the drain. The food is still good, but none of the old employees work there anymore and all the new faces completely ruined it for me.   1. I waited in line for 25 minutes before they could even take my order. 2. The new guy helping me (I didn't get his name) couldn't even ask me what I wanted in my poke bowl. For instance, when it came to my choice of protein, he would look at the protein choices then make eye contact with me and expect me to understand that he's asking me what I wanted (he did this several times before I actually understood what he meant) Are you really that lazy to even speak to your customers? 3. Before putting his mixing gloves on, this same guy above accidentally got his bare hand in my protein with sauce already in it and had the nerve to ask me if I was okay with that and if he can continue on mixing my food. Not once have I seen you wash your hands. You honestly think I'm just going to assume your hands are clean and accept food you got your bare hand in? 4. The entire restaurant is a disaster nowadays. I've been in multiple times these past few weeks and all the tables are dirty, sticky, and the floors have food all over it.  It's really sad to see my favorite poke place fall apart.

Z3OqZ8moQ238wyqertQYBw.text: I was pretty impressed by this place. I wasn't very hungry so i knew the small size bowl would be enough for me at that moment. The employee who helped me was so nice and accommodating. I wish i got her name! But she made my order absolutely perfect! Not too much rice with furikake. I requested tuna with NewYork Sauce along with scallop with spicy mayo for my protein. I appreciate that she was very diligent and precise. She even asked if i wanted it to be mixed in different bowls and if it would be ok if she used the same gloves. That i appreciated even though i did not mind at all. Shrimp tempura, and crab meat on the side. I also like that they give u small sheets of nori if you wanted to make a hand-roll. Mini miso soup for dine-in only!   I had to knock off a star because a small was already $9.50 and it is small, of course additional add ons are $1.50 or so.. it does definitely add up.

UKpAj1-uwWTRgchdIsaTww.text: Poke was good and options offered variety. My sister and I enjoyed sitting outside and talking. The fridge drinks were good, but I would stick with the fountain drink options next time. I liked that they offered desert options and the location was convenient to get to.

9rU0L8c283TbzDCrtKT1GA.text: There are many Poke places in town and I must say this location is excellent! Fresh ingredients and plenty of choices makes it so awesome. A large size is gigantic and medium is nothing to take too loosely! Base choices of rice or greens will keep you happy. Many choices to add and add and add! Most are all that will fit, so very generous here.  A great aspect are the various flavor combinations of special sauces. The proteins are left alone for you to mix or jusr eat and choose as you go. Delicious here, get a punch card and leave your service people a tip. They deserve it! Mmmmm good!

d__xgR9iGbizSnFd_1Kjdw.text: So been meaning to try Poke Poku out for sometime. I had feeling was not more of your traditional True 808 poke but more of the new trendy style of build your own bowl then pick your protein, sauce, and toppings. I truly have no problem with especially when your starving from a post long run and craving raw fish and rice. lol!!! Hawaiian they definitely have that theme down from the minute you walked into the restaurant. It got the island vibe the only thing missing is local hawaiian station. I appreciated that they were playing current music in the restaurant.   It was my first time so went with the Poke large bowl/ I got three different proteins one spicy tuna, salmon, and albacore. My toppings tried not to go crazy. Nothing worst then overkill and takes away from the fish. True Poke never about the sauce but the fish quality. I feel the quality is good at Poke Poku. The sauce went with the LA sauce. It tasted basically like spicy tuna sauce you would get in sushi I felt. Good. The portion size feel like your not getting cheated at all for the money you pay. So many different toppings and options you really could go back everyday for week never get the exact same thing twice. They have nice options comes to beverages. They have refrigerator with different bottle and cans choose from and fresh made teas (three different ones). Not just Poke bowls I got order of gyoza. It was solid. The only thing odd was ask for gyoza sauce it doesn't come with one. They just started serving ramen noodles on the menu.   The service was five stars. The gentlemen making my bowl went over the steps being my first time. Friendly, attentive, and made my first experience great one.

nantl7jrq-VmE0rZq87BPA.text: I got their medium bowl which was more than enough for me. It comes with three scoops of protein so I got two scoops of tuna and one of salmon. I got it with brown rice, seaweed salad, and spicy crab. Also, put in a lot of toppings with it.  Although, I had a lot of ingredients put into it, I thought it was pretty bland. There wasn't really much flavor into anything even with the sauce mixed into it. I've had poke before and it was really good. There was something off about it that I couldn't pin point.   I gave it four stars because it was priced well, healthy, and the service was great. I'm sure if I tried mixing in different ingredients, it would be much better than what I got.  I recommend this place.

Nt_uwwUOAVyfJz69DxEyzg.text: This is a very good place for an inexpensive, healthy meal. They have traditional Hawaiian poke bowls and other imaginative protein bowls, Hawaiian and Japanese fast food dishes and a nice casual atmosphere.

b948eseTq3mzlSvRhm01Kg.text: THEIR POKE ARE SUPER DELICIOUS!! I was shopping at Goodwills and decide to give this place a try! And that was the best decision I've made! I got the medium bowl, their seafood are fresh and cut into a decent size( not too small)! Overall it's just really tasty! I'd for sure come back again and try other menu items! m-jj6EdOkr9q4z91uwB6EQ.text: I have been pretty committed to Toosee Roll, but Poke Poku may be my new favorite.   One reason is the mix of sauces you can have. Definitely worth checking out.

8j9VDq7w9ReMKhDYsdP2Yw.text: A Californian visiting. Oh boy, what a great find. This little gem has great service and super fresh fish. The imitation crab is different than most places - less sweet and more fishy and it works great.  I can even suffer the k-pop for this great food.

cZuYTUY3uBqkDLHnQbgSRQ.text: Woah Ramen was such a good portion for about $5 or less. Their food is fresh, fast, and simple to order. They have a variety of teas to drink from. I love the atmosphere so simple and clean. Spicy ramen was spicy. Good lunch specials, good prices, and fresh food!

xfKG8WeZRiRAaLcLCSRYZA.text: Love the wide selection of choices that you can add to your bowl without the additional prices. To me, that totally makes up for it being pricier. The tempura shrimp topping is a winner for me!  I definitely love the lunch specials for their sushi burritos. It's something I look forward to before a long day of work. If you ever dine in, you also get free miso soup and a selection of free drinks. Albeit so, the drinks are not very great, but it's still a nice gesture for it being free.  I've been to many sushi burrito and poke bowl places, but from my experience, there's not many that come in comparison to this location here on Rainbow. The great quality and wide variety of choices just has Poke Poku coming ahead of the game.

gk4uCFmLYvIqRjyhexXrMQ.text: This is by far my new favorite poke place in all of Vegas!!! The portions are amazing, the flavor of everything is just spot on. The place really brings a nice family atmosphere. Normally poke places I wouldn't make feel full or this satisfied. So happy I don't have to go back to islands or drive to Cali to get great Poke. The staff is great and it has a really great manager! Will try to come as much as often to eat poke.

FU9KW8mG15vaE5QOyJWcZg.text: I have always loved poke, and lately I have been craving it. Too bad Poke Poku is so far from my house, because otherwise I would be visiting this place twice a week. And even at that rate, it would take years to sample all the available permutations.  Poke Poku is set up like Subway or Chipotle, where you stand behind the glass and tell the server what you would like out of an assortment of ingredients. My husband and I both ordered medium bowls, which gave us each three scoops of protein. I had yellowtail, tuna, and salmon; and he had two scoops of tuna and a scoop of snapper. Next up comes two sides (seaweed salad [yum!] for both of us, with spicy crab for me and edamame for him). Then you choose your "mix-ins" (fruits and vegetables [cucumber, mango, onion, etc.]) and "toppings" (salts and spices [roasted garlic, ginger, tamago, etc.]). Last comes the sauce: I chose Hawaiian style (sesame oil, Sriracha, Aloha, and ponzu); and my husband had Japanese style (same as Hawaiian, but swap the Sriracha and Aloha with wasabi mayo). The server mixes these all in a bowl and serves them on your pre-ordered base. We both picked mixed greens, although you could also select rice (white, brown, or mixed) or baby kale (my first preference, although they were out of it when we were there).  As I said, there are thousands of possible combinations to try, but we were both pretty pleased with our choices. The fish was fresh, and the portions were plentiful. I just wish I could have tried the kale.  It's not fancy, but it's filling--and reasonably priced for freshly prepared fish (around $25 for two). So if you're in the mood for some island-style eats, pop on in to Poke Poku!

wq5ez6_h28_xg5G5gwfHgg.text: I love sushi. I love good-quality Poke even more. Poke is from Hawaii, and I am SOOOOOOOOO glad it's now taking over the mainland. It's like sushi, but not little nigiri or rolls, but in a bowl, with lots of yummy other stuff!! You can tailor make your bowl, so if you're not a fan of things like imitation crab, mayonnaise or cream cheese - which you sometimes get as a "surprise" in a sushi roll, you don't have to endure that. So overall, I'm a happy camper. This place is relatively well-priced for a good meal - obviously a bit pricier than going to McDonalds, but... it's a trade-off between health and a slightly higher price point. Medical bills are definitely more expensive in the long run. Side note, did you know that only 4% of the population of Japan is overweight? Some of the main parts of the Japanese diet are fish and seaweed. Makes you think, huh?
