nthFzE7LPZlLstVDkSpxyQ.text: I have been frequenting this location for awhile now but my recent trips has led me to writing this review.   This location suffers from poor management and as a result the wait times are absurdly long. For example, I typed this entire review while maintaining my spot in line. Also played several races in Asphalt 9 and managed a good Reddit browsing session. So in total I've been standing in line for about thirty minutes.   Another mention about management is that the screens are almost always broken. Unless you've been here and ordered before, any newcomer would be adequately confused as they're missing step 3 and step 4 of their poke bowl building experience.  The soda machine has been left unassembled from last night's cleaning more than once. A lady just attempted to get soda and sprayed herself, and my shoes, with soda because of this.   There is clearly not enough staff. Five times I've come, the yellowtail is not prepared. The egg is not ready. The miss soup is not ready. In fact, right now as I'm writing this review, this poor girl has manned the entire front line completely by herself. From assembling to payments, she has been completely alone.   If it wasn't convenient and decent for the price. I would have given up on this location three visits ago. But I believe today to be my last here. Do not visit as they do not care for their employees and store. Please give your patronage to another more deserving store.

They also have so many different combinations of sauces that make the poke even more flavorful. I make my own sauce as a combination of a few of their sauces and it taste so delicious. I've tried both the tuna and salmon and both are great. They also make a pretty stellar spicy tuna option as well.  The sides that are my favorite are the seaweed salad and the shrimp tempura.   I would have given 5 stars but I am not a fan of the new Miso recipe at all. It has a lot of gunk at the bottom of the cup which isn't tasty at all.   One tip: go to Smiths and buy something before you go. They offer a 25% off coupon on the back of any Smith's receipt.

The miso soup is the perfect touch to all the infused flavors. I also love their complementary teas. And don't even get me started on their macaroon icecream mmmm

or9_bP0fwTGS4QTmt1w4lw.text: Great spot for lunch! A bit expensive otherwise. Had their salad special ($7 dollars) and came with an ample amount of food. One scoop of protein (their salmon was fresh), two sides (doubled up on their crab meat salad), and miso soup (dine-in only). Their unlimited toppings are clutch so long as you know what to order. Expansive list so do your homework! Have several types of misago to choose from. Minus one star for the somewhat slow, but friendly/helpful service. Will be back again!

gAevh1gEjl37dTj7DHkA6w.text: I come here often and it's usually 5 stars but this time it fell short. I got the medium bowl with all ahi tuna as always but this time I seen the gentlemen only scoop 2 scoop of protein. When I asked if he put 3 he said yes. When he passed on my bowl the lady was really nice but the gentleman kept taking the sauce she was about to use and mixing a small bowl. There was no one in line! Again when I was choosing my toppings he bumped his way over and started putting things in the mixing bowl so I waited again. Still no one in line.. When I got home I ate my bowl and I noticed that they shorted me. Now I'm thinking that he prolly ate my last scoop as a snack. When ordering beware and watch the amount of protein they put in your bowl.

0CvC8CVAV8pPDUSwGkkH9A.text: Poke poku is not my favorite sushi burrito spot but it isn't the worst! I like that they offer bowls! I prefer the bowls, they have multiple choices of protein to chose from and unlimited toppings and sauces. If you dine in you get free tea/water and miso soup! On weekdays they offer a lunch special $5 sushi burrito! I enjoyed their gyoza which is one of my favorite things on their menu. I think their bowls are a little over priced but their portions are decent.

CZtbVPmYmlUMC8XoneO3SA.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE my poke bowl from here! I'm usually so picky about pokebowls its ridiculous, but this place met my expectation and BEYOND! They literally pack the bowl to the top and they aren't skimpy with your bowls at all unlike other places!! They have fresh ahi tuna which is amazing and i appreciate how they tossed the tuna in sauces before adding them into the bowls! You get a lot of protein in the medium bowl and the toppings is AMAZING. This place is my all time favorite place to go for all my poke needs. The drive is a bit far from my house but it's so worth it. They have a big bar and you can pick and choose what you want in your bowls. Typically i get half and half but i got a full rice bowl here. This is my fave hawaiian poke joint!! They also have so many amazing toppings that other places don't offer as well. The place is fairly big and is always clean! They have a kid area and a drinking station while you wait as well! There's also a princess parking sign outside which is adorable!

nVcYeI9OF0LLHbIO5gpKtA.text: Would have given a 5 star but I felt attitude problem from one of the clerks working & heard her slamming things.  If you're not having a great day, don't take it out on your customers.  Other than that food is delicious.  Would go back, but maybe to another location.

Q4bA97YkNPT7IyQsVg_2ag.text: Best Poke place on our side of town!! Always get the medium poke salad with basically everything! Generous on their fish too :D I go here almost every other week haha

Strongly recommend this for the price range. Just mind that there will be wait time during meal period.... n I will say the food line is not moving fast enough so be patient...

DAw_IGA_9ovAkEEXeRwlyg.text: Such a good poke bowl/burrito place!!! The serving size is huge, and the ingredients taste so fresh. My customer service was great as well. 1VTR13bi1DFwERLRiSCzLA.text: My bowl is awesome. Fish is fresh. Gyoza was yummy. Place clean. Employees are helpful with suggestions. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F4E9qIosZNNCtPUyPYJPJw.text: I'm not sure where to begin! If you're driving through Vegas you HAVE to stop here! I am so impressed with everything about this place, especially the food. Obviously! I got a salad to go, huge portion, and began my way down the steps. You get two sides, and guess what? One of them is crab! Well both if you want! I mixed spicy with regular. Then we move to the beautiful pinkish, red, glorious, AHI tuna that caught my eye the moment we walked inside. Paired with fresh mix ins. I got the poke poku sauce, light siracha of course! The girl (pink hair) mixed the sauce flawlessly making sure the AHI was completely covered. We moved into the additions and I went to town, I recommend the garlic. This is a must! I have never seen this in poke, this is what made the entire bowl stand out.   Everything about this bowl was fresh, and eloquently flavorful! This place has set my standards very high for the next poke place we eat at! Happy but sad! The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They even came out to see how we liked it! Awesome!!!   I would highly recommend this restaurant again. I will be coming back next time in in Vegas! Fantastic!!!

ygistV5RWQvI1aL0SbRC4w.text: Believe it or not, after all the years of the poke bowl craze. I had my first poke bowl late last year. And I'm so sad I had it at Poke Poku because I was in town visiting family and my sister and in law wanted me to try out this place.   Now, since then I've tried a few more poke places. And a good poke place are a few and far in between. That said, I have not come across any other place that compares to Poke Poku.   I would say they are a little pricey. I had a medium with 3 scoops and the scoops weren't that big. But overall, once it was finished with toppings and etc, it was a heavy bowl. The reason why I never tried poke bowls it because I don't like eating rice really (I know, I'm Asian) so I don't like eating rice with any raw fish especially. However I did not mind it. And it's probably cheaper if I ate rice instead of trying to get full from poke, which is impossible!   What I love about Poke Poku is their sauces and the many varieties they have. Their sauces are so darn tasty, I wanted to lick my bowl after I finished it. Many places have the simple spicy mayo, ponzu or shoyu but I'm a girl that craves for flavor. And they offer so many more different toppings (like literally!) compare to other poke places. I just love their variety. They have complimentary tea and miso soup for dining in. I make sure it's my first and last stop in Vegas.

YVDmTeXTJUjtoA_uHAQ_2Q.text: Yum! Delicious poke bowls and the customer service was great. My friend and I informed them this was our first time here and the two workers (male and female) explained the menu and gave us suggestions when it came to our sauce concoctions.   A small size includes two scoops of protein and a medium have three. Our eyes were obviously bigger than our stomachs because we had leftovers with our medium bowls. Def getting a small next time. For my protein, I got two scoops of spicy tuna and a scoop of salmon. Had half salad and half brown rice. There's no limit on sides or sauces. It cost about $12something for a medium but they're super generous with their portions. You want extra jalapenos? Or two scoops of green onions? They gotchu covered.  Also, there's three different kinds of complimentary teas that benefits different areas of your health. This was enough to give them an automatic three stars alone....I haven't seen many places serves complimentary teas like that so big ups for POKE POKU. Whenever I'm craving for poke bowls again, I'm coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium size. Enough for leftovers

EVfQMO45tzszeOElRMY-vQ.text: We have been coming to this place for two years now and tonight was unfortunately not a good experience. 4 people working and the place was a disgusting mess. Every single table was dirty, the floor was dirty and the counter with the food was dirty. Trash was spilling out of the trash can.  They were not busy at all. The teenagers were busy flirting with each other, laughing and goofing around, eating behind the counter and on their cell phones. At one point one of the four employees went to sit with his three buddies who were in the restaurant finishing up eating. No gloves were worn when our food was put together. Only one employee wore a hat. Nobody else had a hat or t-shirt that the employees at Poke POKU normally wear.  I sure hope that the owner takes a serious look at the staff and supervises a little more and raises the standard back to the great place this place was.

y90XTC8Wx0cwqiukSyfB4Q.text: I used to be from the Bay Area and to find a good poke place we sometimes have to drive all the way to Santa Cruz. So imagine our surprise to find a dozen decent poke places here in Las Vegas and I must say this one is probably the best I've to.   Servings come in generous portions. You can definitely taste the freshness of the protein. Of course my all-time-fave is the spicy tuna. They also offer multiple options for toppings and sides which was pretty amazing. My usuals are mangoes, red onions and furikake.   Another good thing is the complimentary tea that they offer. If I'm not mistaken they have at least 3 options.   Servers are nice and pretty fast as well. I've been here only twice so far and there was always a line but they go by quick.   I honestly see myself coming here at least once a week that's how good it is.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OBYFvHBCdfkcbSEyrmH_LA.text: This place is so yummy and cheap! The options are wonderful! I ordered a small which comes with rice, 2 proteins, a special sauce, 2 special additives, and then UNLIMITED toppings.  I got the white rice, with salmon and soft shell crab, with the LA sauce and seaweed salad + spicy crab.   Everything was delicious! The fish was fresh and I received everything I asked for. The only reason I only gave 4 stars is because one of the workers was on her phone while a ton of us were in line. My server was such a nice guy and he called her out for being on her phone but it's still hard to see.   Once again the food was delicious and they have so many great deals!

DpRCOjslpz4fqTw0M0j65A.text: On 5/17/19 I stopped by to pick up a salad. It was 11:04 when I entered the establishment. The door was open, open sign was not lit up, there was a man in line and a person unwrapping what looked like yesterday's left overs and putting them out. I waited for about 10 mins before I decided to ask the man in front of me if he had ordered. He said no, "I guess this guy works in the back and non of the other workers showed up for work". I should have left then but decided that since I've waited 15 mins so far what's a few more mins going to hurt. I also had my youngest with me that was begging me for potstickers (which he only likes from here.) I watched a few people walk in and out because the line was getting pretty long. When finally a gentleman showed up. He took his time walking in and checked his cell phone before greeting the guy in front of me.  I ordered my potstickers first since I know they have to be fried then my salad. The guy was nice behind the counter. He rang me up and then I preceded to wait another 20 minuets for potstickers. By the time I left it had been a hour that I spent waiting around at that location. To my surprise when we got home I didn't even get potstickers I got steamed dumplings and was never given back my stamp card. I found the owners email on Facebook and sent them a email while I was in the restaurant but have yet to receive a reply.   Flash forward to yesterday 5/30 at about 2:15....it seemed like their was a whole new staff working and nobody knew what was going on. Salad was empty and the girl told me were out!? Someone stopped her and told her to get more from the back. I ordered potstickers and they were out of stock. She said don't you mean dumplings I said no Gyoza and she was confused. Proceeded to order dumplings since the 2 girls mentioned them and they were out of those as well.   I really like food at this restaurant but the service has taken a turn for the worse. The fish has also been hit or miss with freshness. Lately it's been super fishy (probably because they are using fish from the day before that's been sitting out). Also, the soda dispenser has been broken for months and the prices are always sitting in a bowl of water on top of the soda drain I will most likely not be visiting this restaurant for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own poke bowl. Medium = 3 scoops of your chose unlimited topping!!

ScpMtRzsa-WhRjiq6S49kA.text: This place has HORRIBLE customer service. We came March 25 at 9:00pm, but they CLOSE at 10:00pm (this is important later on). There were two girls working this shift. One worker was being so reckless that as she was stacking chairs on the tables (at 30min BEFORE they close), she broke off wood-chips from the table behind us and that fell into our drinks. She did not even notice how rude she was, especially since we were still eating. She kept on stacking chairs like no one was there.   The other girl took away the tea drinks around the same time, so we were basically out of drinks while they were still open. They also ran out of the miso soup, so it was pretty much False advertisement of free miso soup for dine-in. The workers also flipped the "Open" sign to "Closed" sign, 10min BEFORE they officially closed.   I hope these workers are reprimanded since this is not how customer service should be. If they want to clean up early, then the given close times at the door should be at 9:00pm instead of 10:00pm.

You all need to remember to add the sauce that people ask for and purchase bowls!!!!

YmdD6ZVVg12qABcu9keToA.text: I have been to this place nothing short of 50 times.  The food is great.  Always has been.  Today though the staff was well below good.  I'm giving them a 1 star based on today's experience.    Shawn and Jelly were the two staff members behind the counter.  First, Jelly and Shawn don't like to wear gloves when they are working with food.  Disgusting. Shawn was serving me and was clearly having a very bad day. It doesn't appear that either of them actually enjoy working there.    The tables are sticky.  I sat in 3 places, all sticky.  The soda machine is broken and clearly has a sign on it "out of order". So I asked for a water.  Jelly instead of answering me decided to tell an employee in front of me.  Literally I asked for a water and she instead of answering me turned to the other employee and said there are water cups in the lobby.  So I grabbed a water cup and told them the water/soda machine has a sign on it that says Out Of Order. Shawn then informed me that the water side still works.  So I go to the to get water and it sprayed everywhere.  They took the spout off the machine and it sprayed everywhere.  When I went back to the front counter Shawn didn't even apologize.  I gave them my cup and grabbed a bunch of napkins to wipe all the spray off me.  He said nothing.  I just said "I changed my mind" and walked to my sticky table to eat my food.    If Shawn and Jelly continue to be here then I will not come back.  Sad was one of my favorite poke bowls. There is another place down the street I guess I'm going to try.

zTds9bIV4Au1hnLMHgoOeQ.text: Customer service exceeded excellence! Two gentlemen, Santos "saint" on his name tag and another guy si Pogi, who were both welcoming and such smiley faces. Portions are fresh and tasty for reasonable prices. My sister and i share a medium and it is plentiful. My parents both got a size small n yet couldn't finish it cuz the portions were huge. Great tasting poke... my favorite poke spot in our neighborhood. two thumbs up

UmzeG5oY62MqyRe2GR45rw.text: I've been noticing their quality has been going down each time I come. Not sure why they got rid of their bowls, but their new cheap plastic boxes are super flimsy and the sauce leaks.

r6BUgue_AYyTLzVqJV1mjw.text: Coming from Hawaii, poke is one of my favorite foods to eat.  There were many that opened within 5 miles and I tried them all.  This one became my favorite - I've filed 2 punch cards already and have recommended it to many friends, neighbors, and anyone looking for poke in the SW area.  Fish are fresh, lots of topping options, and many seasoning combinations to choose from (and you can add different ones for free).  You can make a bowl, burrito or salad.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  When they first opened, services was slower as staff was getting used to things. Over time, it has improved greatly.  They had many specials I was able to take advantage of - free miso soup when dining in, sometimes potstickers or mochi ice cream.  They offer freshly brewed teas for free. Pricing is reasonable and worth the amount they give.

xgg6gtHUF5RFl7DBx1nW0Q.text: it's an okay poke spot. it's cheaper than most places so that's cool. the food is good and the staff is helpful.

-8q-QOMcsGSKruhBieGqew.text: Been coming here for a while and my experience sucked this time around. Service was slow - it felt like the girl had attitude with me. And seemed like they were too lazy. Tuna was one of my protein choices. The girl gave me an undersized scoop. I know it was because she looked in the container for more but didn't see any and just shrugged her shoulders and moved along. I had asked if I could get a bit and she said I had gotten a full scoop. 8B8OiWnqxWg5-3fsaTpaeA.text: I've been to a lot of poke places and this is one of the better ones. The fish taste fresh, the employees were courteous and the place was clean. What else can you ask for? Generous portions of course! I got a bowl and couldn't finish so I took it home for a second round for dinner. Yay! I LOVE spicy foods and their gangster sauce is right up there! Delish food, good service and ice cream. Done and done.

XjlgK15s-oj3TWFxATA74Q.text: Poke Poku was decent. If you dine in, you get a complimentary miso soup and there is also complimentary iced teas on the side counter.   The only downside I would say is their "spicy tuna" is some sort of a mashed up tuna blend served with an ice cream scoop - not what I'm normally use to.   If I come back, I'll make sure to only order the tuna, salmon and octopus as my 3 fish sides.

QtMLenh45uBCgUK27eOhdg.text: I've been here twice now due to the location being walking distance from Brew Tea Bar making it super convenient for me to get my boba fix after, haha.  Food:  Both times I thought the food was just alright... not authentic Hawaiian by any means (the bf is from Hawaii so I've had my fair share of authentic poke), but if you're craving a poke bowl, this will suffice. They offer complimentary miso soup as well as teas (barley one is yum) with signs describing the benefits of each tea - pretty neat!   Pricing: A bit on the pricey side compared to ToSeeRoll which is close by on Rainbow.  Service: What really threw me off the second time I went was the customer service. The girls behind the counter were chatting it up and dancing to the music while taking my friend and I's orders. There was only one other customer in front of us when we arrived, and both of them were helping this one customer while we weren't even acknowledged. By the time they got to us, they were still chatting with each other and we had to wait for them to finish talking before they asked us about the next topping.   Overall: After the experience from our second visit, I don't think we'll be going back. There's much more poke options in the city that are authentic and provide better service.

C5UUPUvQFmaGOrPUVQrZ3A.text: Wow! We were looking for Poke for my fiance's birthday for a quick bite and I saw this place had 5 stars, it was totally out of our way, but we decided to check it out. We were so thankful we did because we loved this place! Super cute decor upon walking to the entrance and inside. The poke was super fresh and had many options. My favorite part was that my salmon pieces were CHUNKS. They were huge! The servers were nice and friendly, answering our questions and helping us decide on stuff. We also got the takoyaki which was yummmy! A huge bonus for us was the Bible verse written on the place mat.  If we lived closer, we would go all the time, but we will definitely still go out of our way for this =)

XwF8yTqw0lTpA1CyNCIb0g.text: This place is the stuff. They hook it up and the misu soup. Yumm. Friendly staff. Food is worth what they charge and I always leave the place satisfied. I recommend to every one. Place is very clean and I'm always satisfied every time I go here.

HBCOBYd5x7RlYOhE1RLHHg.text: Craving a light but healthy and satisfying meal for dinner, I decided to give Poke Poku a try. Wow...fantastic!! The seafood proteins tasted fresh, the wide variety of toppings were great, and the food portions were very reasonable for the price! Patient friendly staff. Very clean establishment and energetic Asian techno pop music playing in the restaurant. I will definitely come back! Oh, and they also offer complimentary miso soup and fresh brewed teas.

Ly-nVE8n8rY1qgvoZiDmCg.text: Big disappointment. The sauce was not well made. Bland and watery. She did not follow all the ingredients listed on the board. Since the sauce was watery, it drained to the bottom of the rice, leaving the salmon tasteless and dry. I feel like I am eating a raw and dry salmon.   I informed the lady about it and all she can say was "sorry". I asked for other sauce on the side and again she did not use all the listed ingredients on the board. She forgets to use the sriracha sauce, and omitted one other sauce.  I just roll my eyes and throw my food away in the garbage.  She needs to be fired as she is bringing this business down.

jL2VTUTl9xjzOotYRfTVVA.text: There are a lot of 5-star reviews for Poke Poku, so I'll let those folks convince you of this place's brilliance. For me it was a bit meh. If you've had poke at Fresh Catch in Honolulu, or the fish market at Hilo, or even Safeway in Lahina, you'll find the offerings here a bit confusing. It's like a buffet -- make your own poke on the spot. The ingredients are all fresh and good, but I think poke benefits from a bit of time sitting and blending the ingredients.   The staff were completely clueless and the process is a bit arcane for a newcomer. There aren't any toro chips for the purists -- they serve the poke over rice or solo in a bowl.

tqTKHxpfXY0_SDUYbj92wQ.text: Place is really nice, hip and modern atmosphere. Walked in and was greeted by a big smile and welcoming attitude. Jayden was the gentleman that helped me out. Told him it was my first time. He kindly guided me through the menu and explained the steps on making a build your own. I got a med build your own poke bowl. $11 not bad 3 choices of seafood. Option of  white rice, brown, half and half, mixed salad, or baby kale. Than next you choose your side, protein, mix-ins, and toppings. Each order served with miso soup. They offer 3 delicious teas for free as well. Definitely worth every penny

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SluAyEzfcbqoKGHvAvW32g.text: This place is super cute on the inside and one of the only places for takeout that offers corn tea! I have never tried poke before, after eating here I wondered why I haven't tried poke sooner!

QOEpEbPYcO8MXWjq7pN3cQ.text: Honestly I would rate it a negative 10 if I could . The workers were so rude with their service . The girl employee asked, if I wanted miso soup i asked my friend if she wanted some . My friend was about to answer if she wanted it , the girl employee said rudly and loudly "do you want it or not" and rolled her eyes .  I was very shocked and disgusted . And the toppings and mix - ins are very limited and they dont have a lot of options .  The prices are okay , if u really want good service and amazing poke GO TO Ted's burrito!!!! Never ever coming here again ! /:

aOQFzh55Rh0brej01UTupQ.text: I love the poke poku bowls and their green tea ice cream macaron. The staff is friendly and helpful.

GwLvLRo8RwHhjttC2pYCBQ.text: Poke poku is one of those places you go to try and then it becomes your go-to spot every time! This place is super cute, the staff are helpful and kind, and the food is AMAZING. Not only are the ingredients fresh and delicious, but the serving size is more than enough. The medium is enough for two meals (for me). They've got a variety of sauce combinations, protein choices, toppings, and so many fish eggs! There's also 3 or 4 complimentary teas for you to drink. I love it! I'm so glad we happened upon this. Check it out!

K7HcxHE6591e6XWqWgu0mQ.text: I've literally tried every poke spot and this is the best one that I've ever had. They STUFF your bowls so much it's great. I get a small and I'm full. They also have medium and large bowls as well. They even have sushi burritos as well! They also have Fried calamari, shumai, and my favorite takoyaki. All the workers are super friendly. They also have complimentary green ice tea, corn water, and barley tea. Oh. And complimentary miso soup when you dine in. They also have lunch specials M-F where one of them you can get a sushi burrito and gyoza for $5.   For the food... Everything is so fresh! And it's soooo good. They also have so many different sauces that you can play with and mix to get which exact flavor sauce you want. This place is amazing! I'll be back :)

a9vBz5CsIc1nexelhgZgsA.text: I give this joint 3/5, I believe my experience could've been better. I don't normally eat meat bc I'm a pescatarian, so I am always eating seafood. I wanted to try some place new and it was my first time here. The poke itself was great, but $10 for a small bowl I didn't think it was worth it. Also, they didn't have any avocados and it was the only side that I was looking forward to getting.  Service on the other hand was alright. I didn't get a chance to catch their names, but this one Asian lady who was serving me toppings was very kind and welcoming. Although, the other worker who I assume is Caucasian wasn't so nice. I asked to sample one of their sauces, but without hesitation she rudely asked "Are you even getting anything.." I mean, I didn't just come to sample sauces. & I felt personally attacked because I am a big fan of poke, and seafood in general.  I'd like to come here again and hope my next experience won't be as bad as this one.

yQKOzkaTS_ik5Wkfb8sOog.text: I like to see roll better.  I came here before for the first time just to try. I ordered a medium bowl and it was more expensive than to see roll.  The lady that mixed my bowl seemed new and didn't know what she was doing.  I told her not spicy, and when i told her to put the best sauce, she put the spicy sauce on my bowl. I didn't come back after that.

NJ0FrcOmIgTOa7zqvidZjA.text: First off let me start off by saying how cute this place is . Inside is super clean and well decorated. The menu is pretty simple step by step . You have the option of a bowl , salad or burrito . The one thing that has shocked me is portions size and quality of the fish . Most places I've tried have nearly diced the tuna or have the crappy smashed up tuna wich I hate . I got a combination of rice spicy crab meat and a portions consisted of tuna, salmon, and octopus. (All scoops were actual scoop size) then my toppings were the usual green onions and nothing too exciting . The sauce i did decide on was there house sauce the Poke poku sauce and it was a spicy mayo ish sauce with a kick . It was delicious. My boyfriend got a salad with all the same toppings as me and the Hawaiian sauce wich was amazing also. This place by far has been my favorite find near me ! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone on the southwest area near rainbow and 215 . They also give you a free miso soup for dine in costumers . I love miso soup but most places miso suck . This place on the other hand really surprised ! The gyoza also was delicious !

We have been here twice and each time one of the owners was serving us. They really take pride in providing you with the best Poke bowl and experience. I get the half ahi and half fried soft shell  crab. Awe man talk about some of the best flavors ever. Also throw the gangsta sauce all of that bowl and you will thank me. Don't forget to add fresh jalapeno also. Love this place and it blows all of the others out of the water.

P-47TKTFMxGknkQlV0jNdw.text: Great fish, good sauce selection, high quality toppings, fresh and tremendous service. We will be back!

tlCeTTnqG_sA3lGIjG9XBw.text: The food was great, well priced, and staff was friendly.  Place is a little small so I'd recommend going when it's not too busy. Plenty of parking in the area, also try the crab meat OMG I died it was freaking amazing !!!

qdSuDaAEeNWPrF-fwmS4gA.text: Okay so this place gets better every time I try it . They have fixed everything I didn't like about the place at the beginning. I love that I can order just the Hawaiian poke by itself, no rice or salad.

1orJGigS6NA7h36vlH1zaA.text: I love the poke bowls. I even got my girl hooked on it too and she doesn't even like the raw fish proteins, but she makes her own bowl with spicy crab and mix-ins. We've been on a Poke Poku kick and have been eating there for lunch all this week! We love it

pRR7Pv7bCb3XY67WEbcvNQ.text: Good place to go for a poke bowl. Fish taste fresh and they are generous on their portions. I also like that they give complimentary miso and tea

SxWw7NiXBtt0YSsVmezuAQ.text: The food here is so good! The ingredients are fresh and I would totally recommend this to my friends. The service is also good and the food is worth the money. The atmosphere of the place is perfect for when you meet up with friends to eat poke.

EfTKFTxS1l8IJy-_7paUCA.text: Came in last night and had a small bowl and it was fricken delicious. Starving after a long day at work the bowl hit the spot! I will definitely be back and fill up my stamp card!

XV2DmBJvjTBepM6MjuXWQw.text: Came during lunch rush hour and they had one person working the counter. Was out of two main ingredients that you come there for. The food I did eat was tasty, but felt I was just settling. To much competition out there to be mediocre. And, we can't stand in line for 45 min when lunch break is an hour. Won't be back. The employee was as nice and good at what she does, washed her hands between ring ups and dishing and personable. Cared about what she was doing. She should find a better place to earn better tips.

zy-3McsvjOoW6w0JgnGZyQ.text: This place is AMAZING! Was craving Poke and did some research.   The girl that helped me was super nice. Will eat here again before I leave Vegas.

DgTEeVnz63tPoSyFwkRLZg.text: This area is well saturated with Poke/Sushi Burrito restaurants and by far this is the BEST of them all. Ambiance has a nice vibe and $5 sushi burrito lunch special is such a great value for what you get. Their portions of topping are just right and the sauces are flavorful. It was our first time here, definitely coming back and highly recommended :)

2_GW45qzk7vqLukTZW5GFA.text: Excellent! Very fresh and delicious. It's a hole in the wall but don't let that scare you from getting it out.

43kHwGgQpehAILsYN4ag7Q.text: Poke bowls are one of my top favorite food to eat.  Look no further this one it the place. I live 20 mins away. If this place was 5 mins away I will eat this every day.

yb20dY93CVZVQX9bFr3mbw.text: Create your own poke bowl or salad. Tons of add-ons and sides. Everything tastes fresh. Good price for what you get. If you like poke and/or want something healthy for a change when eating out, then go here. You won't be disappointed.

Ih_eJ27zBJe7IGzwBU6Frw.text: Best poke on the Rainbow Poke Strip! Great variety of sides, protein, add ins, and sauces.

o613iaX3RYw9Va6IS8tlQA.text: Best poke in town! The fish is super fresh and you definitely get what you pay for. I've tried poke places all over town, but nothing compares to this one. 5 stars for sure!

The people are always friendly, the building is always clean and the portion sizes are very generous!  Even our daughter enjoys the food.   I recommend their Las Vegas style and soft shelled-crab.

P854NwijSiMw64uEi-EsDw.text: The ingredients and toppings selection is great. Creative sauce choices. Generous portions. The complimentary soup and tea are a nice treat. The restaurant is clean and attractive. Overall a good place.

He killed it and we left. The place is always very clean and the front door opens and closes so much it could have easily came right through the front door. Unfortunately, I will have to try some other places for a while.

55o5_7-PhMm4AftitijZWg.text: First time trying this place and not my last! The staff is so nice and helpful, the environment is comfortable and they even have a small bench for children to sit in.

rtVtSYCC71Ot1Zpo84b4yw.text: I loved everything about this place. My new favorite poke spot. The decorations inside was adorable and perfect for the place. It was bright and happy inside. Everything was clean and their restroom even has a bench in it which I took a picture and it smell clean and bathroom was clean. I even took pictures of it :-) You get complimentary tea and miso soup if you dine here. Of course I chose to dine here. I usually get food to go but this place made me want to eat here. They have outdoor seating but it was 110 degree outside when I went on Father's Day. This father brought his two daughters here and they sat at the little kids table which was the cutest thing ever. Servers were really nice here. The toppings here was fresh and plentiful. I loved the variety of choices. I got the small poke bowl with half rice and half salad. I loved that they give you this option cause I wanted the two options. They give you two sides, two proteins choices (freaking awesome because most places only give you one protein choice and then charge you crazy for other protein) and you get unlimited toppings and mix in choices. They don't charge you extra for masago or other toppings choices. I love this place! So lucky I stopped in here. I highly recommend this place.  P.S. bonus points for them because on their sheet tray it says "I love you, lord, my strength psalm 18-1" I just got done attending church and stopped here to eat right after church! If I could give this place 6 stars I would. The owner did an amazing job at this place!

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-XqLMzzPSB5xVH7zz-XRCw.text: Came here with friends...   Didn't order Poke but ordered the ramen and gyoza and it's taken around 15 minutes standing here. I get it that maybe they don't make it often but man don't order it if your are time crunched.   Heard the poke is good though. Good customer service just slooooowwww ramen and gyoza.

xVHGC7eU50jKZYTpvM_ptA.text: So my wife and I was craving for poke, we forgot this little place was in the area.   I ordered the tuna poke bowl with rice. It's a $9 bowl. You get your protein you choose how you want your tuna sauced (they have sauce styles on the wall) and you can pick your toppings right after. The best part is the tea they provide are complimentary! Anyway the tuna is good here, I get scared to order tuna at restaurants because some places put in the chewy muscle (there were none thank goodness) so I enjoyed my tuna bowl.   I ordered a small bowl of rice for my son with 2 pieces of shrimp tempura. They were nice enough to accommodate my picky eating son.  Thank you!   It was a great experience, with good music. When you play Porter Robinson, EXO and Madeon it makes your surroundings even better :)   Our go to spot for poke

nG6etq3mrc2CaVOADUzOfA.text: I was craving poke but wasn't near home so i found this place on yelp so i figured I'd give it a try. It seemed like any other poke place so i ordered a 2 scoop bowl with rice, 2 scoops salmon, ny style sauce, crab meat and some toppings.  It was all put in a tiny bowl so i was a little disappointed. Once i ate it though..OMG! The flavor!! The freshness!! I was beyond pleased!! And the small bowl looked deceiving because there was plenty of food in there for my full meal. My only complaints....the crab was a little too creamy and the forks are super flimsy!! Yes, those are my only complaints! Delicious and will have it again when I'm in the area!!

yArFN1MJTGe-Z-kAUHWwdw.text: Decided to give them a try. Their large bowl gets 4 proteins. Same with all poke bars, good variety of toppings. Most toppings are free. I love the fact they had sides- like my favorite fried shumai. They give a complimentary cup of miso soup for dining in. Atmosphere is more Japanese bar. Not sure where the "Hawaiian" came from aside from some decorative palm trees. Lots of Japanese or Korean music blasting. Staff was friendly just make sure they put their gloves on when serving you.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium and large! Could not finish it

YuMCJlL7qPjGFleoxHZawQ.text: My favorite poke place in Las Vegas. This place has amazing unlimited toppings, reasonable prices, top notch service, delicious seafood, and free miso soup + tea for dine-in. Small bowls will run you around $9 and the large (too much for me to finish) approximately $14. If you're a first-timer, go medium sized, half and half (tuna/salmon), and go from there. The sauces we tried: Japanese and Hawaiian (a little bit spicy).   They've got the largest varieties of toppings of all the poke places I've visited and a loyalty program that rewards you after 10 or so purchases. Highly recommended.

bTfZVmIqe8uBhd-zgjgf-w.text: My wife shared the video of a promo that Poke Poku was having for one day only for $5 for a sushi burrito.   And being from the islands and loving sushi, I couldn't pass this up to try it out.  So many different types of toppings, sauces, combinations.   my wife got white rice with fried shrimp tempura, spicy ahi, cucumber, avacado, and the Poke Poku sauce.  I got white rice with Spicy crab, soft shelled crab, avacado, masago, white onions and the Poke Poku sauce.  both were DELICIOUS!!!   they have a lunch special from 11am - 2pm I believe. sushi burrito with miso soup (dine in only) & water for $6.   When you get the chance, go check them out

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SOOOOO GOOD
Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. first timers, looked good during prep

l6YKYKwhYKuKCL94_8DN6g.text: Definitely not complaining about all the poke spots popping up all over the place. We've been enjoying Sweet Poke for a while but we decided to drive a little farther down the road to check out Poke Poku.  My girlfriend and I both got the "small" salad. America! The portion size was ample. The real difference in the sizes is how many scoops of seafood you get. Two is fine for us, especially since you get so much more along with it.  Cutting to the chase, this is another great poke option in the southwest area. I might ever so slightly favor this place over Sweet Poke thanks to having tobiko in the lineup. The employees were all friendly and helpful as we constructed our bowls. Actually, since we got salads, it's more like a plastic salad container, which I possibly prefer over Sweet Poke's bowls. (It seems like you do get a bowl if you get rice).

bte1cJRKsEIv7ZfxGgFJCQ.text: Oh my God this place is good. I've been addicted to Poke for about 2 years and this is probably my favorite. Here's four reasons why Poke Poku is excellent:  1. You can get soft shell crab as an option. 2. If you want a small portion they have an extra small option. 3. Unlimited toppings 4. You can get yellowtail as an option.  Seriously the bowls are fresh and delicious.

f2wzgYshA4xg2hWCTRSKLQ.text: It used to be my favorite place.I'm a regular customer. I  took online order today afternoon. When I got here two guys who told me they didn't get any online order with poor service, how mean they were. I contacted yelp to show them information about my order. They said already sent order to the store, but they had no idea to deal with online order,They missed.If you don't take online order anymore please just turn down online service. Don't waste our time and money.

8bKNQyf8tQCU3PMdKCT9Vg.text: This is my favorite poke place in town that I've tried. I've been to various places in the Southwest area and in random spots and none have as good toppings and other options as Poke Poku - it's quickly becoming my go-to for takeout in general.   The portions are very generous- I can barely finish the small size and when I tried the medium I had to save about half for later. They have a board with sauce mix suggestions which are good for those who are indecisive- my favorite is LA style (I ask for yuzu ponzu too for that sourness). The service has always been friendly as well and they have stamp cards. The only thing I dislike is that they play music extremely loudly so it's hard for them to hear me order (and I can't hear them well either). Other than that, Poke Poku is great.

_j5ugVVxX16n4o0kfIkacQ.text: Stopped by for a quick dinner on a Wednesday night.  The decor is fun and comfortable. The service is friendly and prompt. The menu is fairly easy to read and understand.   The standout quality of this place is their variety of ingredients that you can have added to your bowl or salad. You really can load up on a ton of stuff.  Overall the food tasted very good and clean. I would return.

UBFGFcwk3lmc6lAnbuAPQA.text: One of my go-to's for lunch! Love getting the $7 poke salad or $5 sushi burrito. Both come with miso soup and AYCD flavored water (it's a thing) if you dine in. Each come with 1 scoop of protein and ate very filling so don't think it's never enough. I like trying different combos of proteins, mix-ins and toppings. Whatever you get, it's almost always going to be Instagrammable anyway so go crazy with your choices. Big fan of Hawaiian or Japanese style! Also, they have loyalty cards. Buy 9 get the 10th free! Great friendly and vibrant ambiance... Nice escape from confines of work.

I3Q1i0_b4JiqaMGsViiQCg.text: Typically use the EAT24 app to order and I always do the burrito combo with a drink and dessert and I have the option to get the tornado potato. Then when I go to pick up the food, they never have the potato so I have to resort to their brick hard macarons. Food is good, but their service and customer service is

rZX47sBJtvErvJe7_hEakA.text: My new favorite poke place!!   Food is fresh and delicious!! Friendly employees!  Great prices.   2 thumbs up!   I won't be going anywhere else.

grIlNY8YesT0meqTyqqpqw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! The portions are very generous and the staff members are so nice and friendly!  The dining area feels very spacious and we've taken a group of 4-8 people from the office for lunch.  The staff remembers their returning guests and they're always smiling when they serve you.

ud2BF5es36aW5g6QkbjExA.text: This poke place is among many that opened on rainbow last year. It is in the same plaza as goodwill. I've been to this establishment twice and the second time was just as good as the first.   Poke poku is similar to the other poke places in the way that it's a chipotle style way of ordering. I ordered a small bowl & that came with 2 scoops of protein. She pulled out the bowl & I thought to myself, "wow. That is so small. How am I supposed to get full off of that..." to my surprise, I could barely finish it. They really pack on the protein & the fix-ins! So the reason why I'm giving 4 stars is because of their shrimp tempura & soft-shell crab. I think it's great that the shrimp tempura isn't extra & you can just add it to your bowl, BUT when I tried it the first time I came here... it was horrible. It was cold & stale & not edible. I learned the second time I was here, but my friend got the soft shell crab & he made the same comments. I think they should really fix that.   The service here though is A1!! Will come back but probs not for the fried stuff lol.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small on the bottom &amp; large up top.

H97KPHG5E5VwWc5H5MMc7A.text: This place is a favorite of mine because it's healthy and good! I love how aesthetic and cozy the environment when I ate. They give you miso soup every time we dine in, and free tea that is good for your body! It's a little pricey but it's worth it in my opinion!

wslcyWHE335Trqi03ojprg.text: I've been here probably like 10x, thank goodness there's one on rainbow on my side now. So far I love it. It's like the Chipotle version of poke bowls, you can customize however you like it which I love. Every concoction I've created was always good. They also have a variety of Hawaiian/Japanese canned coffees. They also serve other appetizers like gyoza and takoyaki

uCLV-qRp3DuENFNgC0C1aw.text: CUSTOMER SERVICE IS GREAT!!!   My friend and I came in the other night because we were craving salmon. I got a salmon poke bowl with yellow tail and shrimp tempura and crab meat. I am really indecisive in choosing toppings and sauces but the staff was so patient and personable, they really made my experience their great!   The only thing they should do better is if they know they have a large crowd coming in for their lunch special, they should make more salmon to accommodate the customers. Other than that, I highly recommend this place.

O2LZMOaHvtoUD-JIb0Z5lA.text: What is just now starting to sweep the East Coast is a firmly established presence on the West to my total delight - and POKE POKU exemplifies what it means to be a solid Poke/Sushi Burrito joint.  POKE POKU is located in a strip mall with ample parking. Not too busy with seating for dine-in (if you dine-in you can also have their complimentary teas and a miso soup). I opted for quick take-out of two medium Poke Bowls. THANK YOU for having octopus and scallops as protein options! Everything was fresh and oh-so-yummy. A great variety of sauces, toppings, sides, etc. that is sure to please any poke fans. A medium was more than enough and was under $13. They also offer some desserts such as macaron ice cream or fish ice cream (ice cream served in a fish-shaped fluffy pastry).  Great place. Ability to order via Yelp a plus. Will totally return.

qRw96euygxRI3hRHWM0Ywg.text: I like the quality of fish here. The sauce option is good. My only complaint is that when you order medium to large bowl there're lots of rice but the sauce they put on the fish for these sizes are not enough so bottom of the bowl will get no flavors

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takeout 3 large bowls

tXIS9tEDPxcopUqIr1N7jw.text: Amazing management and clean,  delicious food!!!! I order from postmates all the time and their tea is super good.

xoHURakgm-Y9Od-bK5n8vQ.text: Its our first time in here and Im sure we will be coming back again!  I got size medium and you can get 3 scoops of protein for that. I got two scoops of salmon and one scoop of yellowtail. You can also get 2 shrimp tempura for your sides!!!  Free miso soup!!! (Dine in only)  Atmosphere is really chill. You can get these healthy water for free also.   The girl that was working when we went is really friendly. In fact,  out of all the poke bowl places Ive been too shes the only one that smiles lol. Oh I dont know her name but she has a nice pink hair.

KnuJbO__-CrkqBA-AqYyYw.text: I love poke bowls!   It's a great lunch option as the small bowl is the perfect amount of food for me and I truly enjoy the fun environment here. They play j-pop videos and I find myself always in a better mood by the time lunch is coming to an end.  So why the 3 stars? 2 reasons -  They advertise fresh avocado and even show it in their own marketing images but what they really offer is mashed avocado only. I'm not a fan of mashed avocado in my poke bowls plus I strongly feel that you should sell what you advertise. And the second reason is that the bowls are more expensive than their competitors by $3-$5 and there's tons of competition out there.  Pros: Complimentary miso soup (dine-in only) Complimentary teas (a variety of fun flavors) Fast & friendly service Build your own business model Lots of delicious toppings and sauces

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small bowl ~ tuna and soft shell crab
Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own bowl :)

nIFCLQOKJk9e9T9kR7yJ6A.text: Rainbow Blvd in the southwest seems to have a poke place almost every block and Poke Poku is one of the first ones you'll come across when driving south of the 215. The concept is similar to others, with their Subway/Chipotle-style of customizing your order, as are their options. But, they do have items like soft shell crab, octopus, and scallops, which others do not. Also unique are their suggested combination of sauces like LA Style (sesame oil, spicy chili, aloha sauce, and sriracha), Korean Style (sesame oil, aloha sauce, Korean spicy chili), and Japanese Style (sesame oil, wasabi mayo, and ponzu).  Their medium bowl ($11.50) is slightly more expensive than other places, but my bowl consisting of brown rice, seaweed salad, crab meat, tuna, yellowtail, octopus, masago, red onion, cilantro, pineapple, crispy onion, roasted garlic, bonito, ginger, sesame oil, sriracha, ponzu, and aloha sauce was more than enough. The quality of their product was pretty good, but nothing stellar.  Complimentary beverages are available, too. Burdock root tea, roasted corn tea, and jasmine tea are all up for grabs. The roasted corn -- as strange as it sounds -- wasn't bad. It was basically like corn flavored water.

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium poke bowl ($11.50) - brown rice, seaweed salad, crab meat, tuna, yellowtail, octopus, masago, red onion, cilantro, pineapple

9br6aUKNOrd8s7mHTG3Lbw.text: I've been to a couple poke places around town and this might be my new fave! The overall vibe and chill staff made my experience pretty enjoyable. They're hip with it. They even have takoyaki.  What did it for me was that they offer complimentary tea and miso soup. It's the little things. I love all the toppings and they have tamago! If you knew me, you know that I have this obsessive relationship with eggs.  I can't get over how cute this place is honestly. I can't think of any complaints from my visits and can't wait to come back.

f3zzxpsk3T1zJ3Nsf9V8_w.text: Las Vegas poke scene has expanded rapidly and there are so many (too many) options to choose from. What attracted me to this place was the fact that Poke Poku is a "Hawaiian" poke bar but I'm a little confused because nothing was really Hawaiian about this place. I don't think they got da kine here, da Hawaiian kine.   What do I expect from a place that calls themselves "Hawaiian"? I'm looking for friendly aloha vibes. Broke da mouth grindz.  Instead what I got was not so welcoming service, expensive/small portion and subpar food. Yes, I know poke is not the cheapest lunch. But compare to other poke options in town, this was the least amount of food I got for the price I paid.   I did enjoy the different sauce combinations they offered, as well as their unlimited topping options. I ordered their poke bowl with salmon and various toppings, then chose poke poku sauce to go with it. Sauce was good, and not overpowering as I expected it to be. Overall it was pretty average.  I must say as a tea enthusiast, their complimentary tea bar was the highlight of my visit. They have 3 different tea options and all teas are nice and refreshing.  For Hawaiian poke bar and True ono grindz, I prefer Paina cafe over this one.

O0T-CaveE8puPx-Mh1xEXA.text: Ok. Went in on a whim. Just great. Wife and I both ordered the large salad. So much sushi grade poke fish on top. Let him sauce it himself. They let you choose the toppings, but I wanted to trust their judgement.   It did not disappoint.   Top tip. Only order the large if you are HANGRY. Next time I'm getting a size smaller.   I'm stuffed, but happy.

zbOkfRh6rcysMsmjG2GdUg.text: Poke bowls are delicious and light but yet filling.The staff is always friendly, attentive and fast, so you're in and out in a minute or two! Perfect for a healthy lunch.

I got a medium and it came with a base, 3 scoops of protein, 2 sides, and unlimited mix ins and toppings. I could barely finish half of it.   I would definitely come again whenever I'm in the neighborhood :)

OA2Mt-phSE2gib_x5wFPHw.text: Wait. Hawaiian?? I thought it was Japanese. Oh well. It is terrific whatever it is. Delicious every time - this is about my 6th visit. Poke Poku is consistently good and fresh, food items are always stocked and the complimentary miso and tea are a nice touch (hey people don't complain about price until you look at the whole pic here!) Only one complaint: would much prefer freshly sliced avocado over mushed. Maybe that's just me though bc I have the same complaint at Subway, as I LOVE me some fresh avocado - the yummy superfood!  You can't go wrong w the Poke Poku sauce or the LV Style sauce.  The girls working today - Sun afternoon - are both polite, efficient and hard working. (Asian girl w long braids and blonde w med length pony tail/forearm tat).  Don't be intimidated first trip if you have never been to Poke Poku, just let them know and they hopefully will walk you through the steps to building a bowl or a burrito - and if you're lucky you won't get the impatient guy I had the first time YEEESH.  Try the Coffee Macaron Ice Cream sandwich if you didn't fill up on a huge bowl. Mmmm!

photos.caption: Photo of POKE POKU  Hawaiian Poke bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small bowl, 2 proteins...delicious fast and fresh!

FdG0LdQJwKUpfTlzEzTpEw.text: I came in today for a Poke salad and one of the workers there, Jada, gave me great customer service. She was very helpful and just greeted me with a big smile. My poke salad was fresh and delicious! Definitely coming back!

SubwGiHkFE62IB08zSvytg.text: If this is Hawaiian Poke, I'm a Russian Princess.  But I'm getting ahead of myself.  Rant: pineapple, mango, corn, siracha, ponzu, eel sauce.  No, no, no, no, no, no!  We don't put these things in our poke in Hawaii!!!  Stop calling it Hawaiian poke!  Don't even get me started on putting pineapples on pizza.  Grrrrr.  That said, what is offered is very good "SoCal style" poke bowls and wraps.  Keeping it real, the seafood is previously frozen but not gassed or treated with color additives.  All good, the norm.  Crab is imitation, AKA krab.  Rice is of average quality, Best when served warm. Veg is fresh. Finally sauces, bold, all with a nice sesame oil flavor, those containing ponzu, have good acidity making them refreshing.  Tip: pass on poke only.  Poor value at $22/lb.  Ordering is, well you know the drill. As a bowl or burrito (the bowl is better as the burrito is so stuffed it oozes out and falls apart).  Mix and match up to three proteins to satiate your hunger. It's your creation.  Unlimited toppings a plus.  Servings are generous.  Free miso soup (dine in only).  Look for check-in offers (10% off with yelp or Facebook check-in's as of this writing).  Extremely friendly and patient off strip service.  Novices need not to stress.  Solid and an A=OK place to grab a bowl.  Mango poke, sheesh...

pS00prBHiXib1jePQCdUEA.text: Found this place on yelp with tons of great reviews and decided to check it out. Honestly wasn't to impressed with their poke bowls. They definitely do go above and beyond with toppings and options, however their fish is sub-par. Personally, that is the most important part of a Poke dish.   Poke has become a big thing, and can be found everywhere now a days. Problem with that are places like these that don't give Poke the great name. Worst part is they still charge the same as the places that truly have the great fish and much better bowls.

J14yoS5gni-zlTBfEOR-Sw.text: The food is solid here, it really is. My favorite spot. However, it ALWAYS seems like the workers HATE their jobs here and today, my goodness...  There was a line right when they opened and the girl that helped us seems PISSSEEEDDD OFF. Two groups left while standing in line. The girl didn't say hi to ANY of us and we truly felt like we were making her job a lot harder by being here. I don't know what is going on but management should either look into fixing the way they run things or train their employees a bit more because it's getting worst and worst every time I come. Everyone is looking at each other right now like the energy in this entire place is just so sooo heavy (I'm assuming that's why the two groups left.) I said thank you twice, the girl didn't say anything, then I yelled "THANK YOU" one more time and finally she said, but out of the 8 separate groups of people I saw in line, not once did she do a "hi how are you?" And "Thank you! Have a nice day!" I completely get the people have bad days but to come into work and let that energy reap the entire room, that's not good business practices

wbKE954tRYBLCC_7Rr8gCg.text: I came hungry and left extraordinarily full, which is not always an easy feat at a poke place. Usually when I go to poke places I get a large because for some reason I'm always still hungry. I got a medium here and couldn't even finish it.  Even though I've been through a good amount of poke places, the steps are very helpful. One huge plus here is that they mix everything together. Something different here is that they offer a spicy crab meat and also shrimp tempura. I really liked the spicy crab meat, it was a nice addition. They also have the option of pineapple and mango as toppings, which isn't offered everywhere.    I was really overwhelmed at the end trying to read all the sauce combos. I just didn't bother anymore and added whatever sauces tasted good in my mind.   The poke bowls are a little more on the pricier sides, but worth it. I couldn't even finish everything.

N8RJDvhSAdPX01dcgZZM9Q.text: Best poke in Las Vegas! Definitely miss good poke being originally from OC.  I really like how they have a lot of options.  Out of all the poke places I've tried, this one stands out the most with Soft-Shell crab!  good stuff!  Service is really good, and they have complementary teas (Burdock, Jasmine, Corn, and Barley).  Sushi also tasted very fresh.  They also played Kpop/BTS!  Highly recommend and you won't be disappointed. ***Be sure to check-in on yelp for 10% discount!***

VkF1BGrMjWANsZSyumgltQ.text: I love this place!!! Tried it for the first time and it's good I wish there was one in Chicago!!!

CvGeoJY8vKWuKNh3VIpidw.text: Hands down the best poke bar in Vegas! The staff is super friendly & the prices are reasonable. Can't beat the unlimited toppings & appetizer selections! My best friend and I come here almost every other week.

avJZMVJFNakVKluPNxcl8A.text: This place has the best poke I've ever had! Great service, dope atmosphere inside, and good music. Food is top quality and healthy too! Definitely come here if you like Poke.

AMUI8w5Fb4uWuTv2I9TtwA.text: So far so good. Very friendly, everything looks good. Love this place. Food is fresh and workers are friendly!

4AFHOjMDBWxKsCYX9WFY2w.text: Visiting my In-laws and ran into this place by accident when checking out an Ice Cream parlor next door.  Did not check reviews here on yelp but was hungry and wanting to try it out.   Wow!  By far the best Poke express bar I have been too.  I was blown away.  They weren't stingy on the Poke nor any other fresh fish that was available.  They had many topping options to choose from, and more additions to your bowl other than the places I have tried.  To top it off, they had free ice tea with 3 different flavors to choose from.  Definitely going to be my preferred stop for Poke next time I'm in Sin City.

KeNZ9hwgDrL-afOAD8GHBQ.text: In love!  Our girlfriend suggested coming here for lunch.  We have been in Las Vegas for about 3 months and haven't tried sushi burrito yet.  We met up here around 1 PM, with 3 other friends.  The process was super easy.  We all got a sushi burrito with one protein, some gyoza, and tried their teas.  Everything was tasty and fresh.  The staff was super helpful and friendly.  Free wifi.  Clean.  Can't get any better.

y_vqOqKCQ8BDCYyrwmgdNg.text: Yummy food, not so great experience. Last night (Friday, Nov 24) I made an order via Yelp and it's actually tied to Eat24. After I paid for my order, it instructed me that it would take 40 minutes to pickup from the time it was confirmed (takes only 5min to assemble). Maybe they were busy at the time. Showed up at 40 minutes (8:20pm) to an empty restaurant with two young girls (employees) eating on a table at the side. I was quickly greeted and one of them went behind the counter to wait on me. Upon informing her I was there to pickup an order from Yelp, she panicked, went to the side to grab a piece of paper and whispered to the other girl that they forgot about this one. She came back to me and told me sorry, they had customers, they forgot all about it, and that it wouldn't take long. I said that it was fine and knew it wouldn't take long (which is why 40min was a little much of a wait). Just not very professional or responsible to forget an order. Lucky I wasn't in that much of a rush, which is why most people order online (so that it's ready for pickup when they arrive). Someone else may have even left a single star, even though the food is amazing. The 3 stars is for the food, and would have been 5 if this was an altogether smooth experience. Also, the reason they did not get a tip. You never know what will happen, so I tend to tip after I have all my info. No sense tipping on my card when they forgot about my entire order lol that's just not smart. Place was clean, as always. The manager just needs to hire people with more focus. I'll still go back, just won't order online again.

eYfHdzUiPxYNvW7hDLxHrQ.text: I didn't receive my complete order the chef decided to make some adjustments to my order I won't order from this place again

Fw8kRHigoS6P4LaBbaC5_w.text: Wow !! This is the best poke place I've been too. They hella pack your bowls and you definitely get your money's worth. Also they just started a HOT CHEETO BURRITO !!! I highly recommend.

LygL2k7qdpES3VGKbWuaOw.text: This place is pretty good. The staff was nice and hooked us up with a good amount of fish. My boyfriend and I were so full from the medium bowl but it was satisfying. The price is good for the amount of fish & extra toppings you can get. I also liked the fact that the spicy ahi was actually SPICY. I feel like its just missing something to really make it my go to poke spot since theirs three near me. Also I was a bit confused by the ambience of the place. Being from Hawaii I wanted to try this place because it says "Hawaiian Poke Bar" but its not like Hawaiian poke that you would find in Hawaii. All together this place is alright I think I was just expecting and wanting more from it.

-rxJNZoKOfKaCoBKln3hcA.text: Two words AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!! I love this place, it is a must every time we visit Las Vegas.

Pmy6tmOgsxPd9aPC62cELQ.text: I love this place! I go here almost every week . Me and my man love the large poke poku style bowl.now we are a vip!

GHy51kTKo0-Gw60cIVK95g.text: Wonderful fabulous delicious what else can I say.  I LOVE healthy.  Excellent service.  Fast.  What more can you ask for.

ESxNmVakUnk7iVX1oV_ksQ.text: Nice, helpful, and very friendly staff at this establishment. The Poke bowl is also well deserving of 5 stars. Fresh ingredients and all kinds of different combinations of building your burrito or poke bowl. This is place where a Poke fanatic must stop by and try. To me it was my favorite from other Poke Bars in this area.

lOzpHuI-Tvt6ZRmKU_pQJw.text: I really enjoyed this place.  I love the option of building your own bowl. I did scallop and octopus and it was so good.  I will definitely go back.

aEzU-uBo1YbN9QQw_4H1-Q.text: So glad we ran into this place. Brand new I think; in the new plaza where the goodwill is. The fish is super fresh and they do not skimp you on portions. There's a lunch promo for $5 sushi burrito and $7 poke salad that comes with miso soup! Also complimentary tea!! Our total was a total of $12 and some change. UNHEARD OF. Seriously a STEAL. So many toppings and options. They also make a crab mix with real crab which was bomb with my salad. They have various sauces too with cute names. I tried the vegas style which was sesame oil, "Gucci" and ponzu. Lol they also have fresh marinated garlic as a topping which is BOMB that I don't see often in other poke places. Only downfall is there is no cream cheese which my boyfriend always requests with anything poke or sushi. Lol we literally killed both of our orders though. The small salad is a good portion. Next time I'm thinking on trying one of the bowls. The environment is clean and cute and have a cute little bench table for the kids too. Haha. def a must try for lunch at least. U can't beat the price.

EGER2Sk-ODAyzda8OtvaoQ.text: This is my absolute favorite place to get Poke ! They also have an amazing lunch deal from $5- 7 . I've tried A lot of places and they are the best !! Fast and friendly too

nOp94bgGeUgVL_rvtvB7XA.text: This is the best poke place I've been to! I've tried a few in SoCal and another one in Vegas. They have a great selection of fish, toppings, and sides. My favorite fish: albacore, red snapper, yellowtail, and salmon. It also comes with a free miso soup when you dine in. Wish they had one in SoCal bc I would keep coming. Definitely recommend if you're in/from Vegas!

wH8myni92qrAxJpCpFF56g.text: This place is OK, I went there for the lunch special which include sushi burrito, miso soup, "healthy water" and gyoza +$1.50. When i started ordering the lady who's making my food said that miso soup and water only if you dine in, but if you check the huge sign they have outside it doesn't say dine in only. So she went and checked with the manager she said yes it's only for dine in she end up charging me for the burrito and the gyoza. What I wanna say is that they have False advertisement, they couldn't even honor it. On the other hand my boyfriend was ordering his food and he asked for shoyu soy sauce and the lady said that they don't have it. Which poke place don't have shoyu soy sauce!!!!!! I will never go back!!!!!!

9gMLDYDpeE5FfRBLcfQF4Q.text: Just finished a poki bowl and I'm really impressed. This place definitely is a must try. Mix the Korean hot sauce with the Gucci sauce and its money! Healthy and filling... I will be back!

nmN9BxJTYpPVn91e7Obc_Q.text: Really good poke. They have many sauce mix and i want to try them all. This place has good customer service and friendly atmosphere. I will definitely go back again and will tell friends about this poke place.

rtt4cv-_APpoiaFULsDQmQ.text: Great service and fresh food. The staff are really helpful as this was our first time eating here and they explained the menu and offered recommendations.
